Food was great. Definitely get the chicken liver pate for appetizer. The pork pot pie is very good. I'm from the South so the fried chicken didn't hit it for me. Wife got the steak, it was good. The kimchi and kale as a side is very good. It will be hard but try and save room for dessert. Their pastry chef is highly regarded and if a special is offered take it.  We had several and they were fantastic. Like, make your tongue feel special type good. The ambiance is very cool considering it's one of the oldest restaurants in Brooklyn.

No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

What a fun spot! Located kind of down a dark alley, this restaurant was packed and full of customers! Our waiter was very attentive and helpful giving us his recommendations. We ordered a lot of their specials, the full fish, and the baked Alaska which was DELICIOUS. 10/10 would recommend.

I stayed in Brooklyn for work and decided to check out Gage and Tollner. I made a reservation two days in advance, but I also dined on a weeknight. Upon entering Gage and Tollner, you can't help but notice the amazing retro decor and ambience. The bartenders were mixing up cocktails, and the crowd was buzzing in conversation. I sat down at a small table and ordered a whiskey sour. When I received my drink, I was initially taken aback by the ice in my cocktail. Ice in a whiskey sour?? It still tasted good. I ordered a New York strip and a side of mashed potatoes. The steak was cooked perfectly medium rare and had a good char. The steak was so flavorful with the garlic, it was almost too powerful when paired with the mashed potatoes. The mashed potatoes were also very rich and delicious. The steak was a little chewier than I'd hoped for, but all in all this was a good meal.

This is such a quintessential New York restaurant. My Dad went to Gage and Tollner in the 80s, back when he was dating a girl from Fort Greene. My Aunt went to Gage and Tollner on her last day on the job when she worked in downtown Brooklyn more than 20 years ago. I'm sure others could find similar stories if their family members spent time in Brooklyn and were fortunate enough to visit. What I'm saying is that Gage and Tollner is one of those iconic restaurants. That means something. The landmarked interior is gorgeous, the food is good (the desserts are absolutely phenomenal), and it feels like a special event, even if it's just a Tuesday (and they save tables for walk-ins: try your luck any night of the week).

I finally got a chance to dine here and I gotta say... the hype is real. First, the space is beautiful, full of history, and quite lively. Service was excellent - friendly and attentive at all times. We enjoyed every single dish we had. Out of all the appetizers we had, my favorites were the clams and the beef tartare. The steak was perfect and the sides complemented it very well. The Baked Alaska was a fun way to end our evening and surprisingly enough to share between 4 of us. It seems like you really can't go wrong with anything here. Wonderful place for a special night!
No comment
No comment

Still killing it in every department - I'm not unbiased as I have eaten here about 10 times now - but every time has been stellar. Even though it is traditionally a steakhouse, don't miss the rest of the menu - just incredibly good takes on almost every classic steakhouse fave plus more - the service is even better (they have been practicing! The place is popular!) and the ambiance is unbeatable in NYC - worth going just for that!They are doing it right, and now with the sunken harbor club upstairs, it might be one of the best cocktail places in NYC as well.. call ahead, but don't be afraid to try a walk in @8:45... worked for me a couple times!
No comment

Terrible experience. The restaurant looks like it could be amazing but... we waited two hours for a table which fine because we were a table of five and without a reservation I 100% understand. However, once we got to the table, drinks were stingy and the steak was extremely disappointing... we ordered the steak medium rare... the first time we ordered it came well done and the second time it came blue, which if the waiter cared even a little bit he would of checked but obviously he didn't. Please see picture for evidence! It was extremely sad because we went for my brother's bday and that wasn't even acknowledged. So no I do not recommend and there are so many delicious restaurants do not waste your time..
No comment
No comment
Great location (down town Brooklyn near public transportation), excellent customer service and delicious drinks. Give it a try!
No comment
No comment

I wasn't so impressed by the waiter.. I asked him "what's your best on the menu?" His response was.. "the menu reads what exactly it means" no bread were offered, oyster/clams too fishy, steak was good but too small to share 28oz, mash and mushroom were mediocre, desserts sundae and cheese cake was ehh too.. overall B grade., we wanted to order more but never told of last call..don't think I'll come back for seconds
I loved the ny strip steak and hashbrown. The service was quick and friendly. I would definitely come back again!
No comment
Gorgeous as ever and the food was fabulous! Worth the splurge. Go and step back in time
No comment
We had a late reservation on a Monday night and showed up with an additional person. G&T's staff was accommodating and provided excellent service and food. Good job.
No comment

We loved Gage and Tollner! It's got such a classic vibe and the atmosphere is romantic but not super fancy. Very approachable. Perfect for a date night or dinner with family. Service was lovely and attentive and the meal was very well timed. It's located in a weird part of Brooklyn but the restaurant itself is special so it's worth the trip.

This place is such a treat. It has such an impressive ambiance but isn't pretentious and is priced like any other nice NYC restaurant. I'm a vegetarian and I actually love this steakhouse - they have lots of veggie soups, salads, and apps, plus 1-2 mains (haven't tried those yet though.) The fried mushroom app is great, as are the onion rings and green salad. The baked Alaska is a can't-miss. They do lots of other fun seasonal rotations too. I love sitting at the bar with a drink, an appetizer, and a book. They have an overflow for the bar upstairs and a whole tiki speakeasy too with delicious drinks.
No comment
No comment

Service was impeccable food was amazing!! The ribeye was perfect porter house was amazing and the mojito cocktail was perfection perfect combo of alcohol not to light not to over powering just perfect

Went here for dinner as two walk-ins, the room had a really aesthetically pleasing atmosphere, we were seated almost right away. The NY strip was amazing, one of the best steaks I ever had. Finished the dinner off with a baked Alaska, it was soo goood. Shout out to the amazing staff. I had such an amazing evening.
No comment
No comment

I wanted to love this steak house. I love the ambiance old historic feel.  Has kept to it's reputation of stepping back in time when you come in. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Unfortunately our steak came out rare.  We had ordered medium.  They brought us our sides and steak and we had to send the steak back. I was hoping they would not just refire the same steak as it dries it out and just adding butter to cook it fast doesn't add to the flavor. I was disappointed greatly at receiving a refired steak that cost 150 dollar sor more. For that cost make it right or re do it. I expected the quality to hold to it's reputation.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Went here for my birthday dinner -- it really is a special occasion type place -- and have to say I was slightly disappointed with the Christmas decorations (or lack thereof) as I really thought they would have gone all out. But regardless! Service was amazing, drinks were awesome, the food was delicious -- we ordered way too much -- and I think I would come back again to order a bunch of apps as they have a really good selection. It is insanely expensive though. As I said, it's a special occasion type place, and I'm not 100% sure the prices are worth the hype but I'm willing to give it another try.
No comment
No comment

Billed as one of the oldest restaurants in Brooklyn and you felt that as you approach the restaurant. The outside facade feels almost historic for the downtown Brooklyn location. We ordered several dishes starting with appetizers the beef tartare, onion rings, crab cakes. The tartare was delicious and the onion rings had almost a sweet spice to it. For the entrees we had the NY Strip, the rib eye, the shrimp scampi and the salad. The ny strip was ok the meet was a little chewy. The rib eye was delicious and cooked perfectly. Will definitely be back!

Brooklyn was once a separate city from New York with its own mayor and municipal government. A short walk from Brooklyn City Hall (now Borough Hall) was Gage & Tollner. The center of the Brooklyn culinary/civic/cultural universe for well over a century was Gage & Tollner which many even considered It to be "Brooklyn's main contribution to civilization." When Gage & Tollner closed its doors a decade ago, most thought that it was gone forever until a plan was hatched to bring it back. Due to reopen on March 15, 2020, the very day that New York City closed for the Pandemic, it seemed that it was truly doomed. But it was not and Gage & Tollner is back to its original form. Now people from Manhattan travel to Brooklyn for great oysters and steaks, IF they can get a reservation. And that is a big if since it one of the toughest reservations to get in all of NYC. The food, cocktails and service are totally 21st Century even if the ambiance is reminiscent of the 19th Century. For a truly wonderful evening, head over to Brooklyn and snag a table at Gage & Tollner. You won't regret it!

The absolute worse meal.  They seated us next to a couple with two screaming little kids who were kicking the booth and making a huge scene for over an hour. When we said something nicely to them the entitled mom had a fit got up and got in our face and made religious slurs at us and said since she waited over two hours for the table she was able to do what she wanted and the restaurant did nothing to mitigate  the situation.  Who takes a 2 yr old out at 9 at night and waits two hours!! This was by far the worse dining for the money in over ten years.  BAD management. Never offered to move our table, even though we complained. Did not come over once  or offer even a drink as consolation. Save your money and run far away.  Crowded, impersonal and really bad.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
The food was exceptional and exceeded our expectations! This is a timeless place with timeless service. 20/10, we will be back for more!
Probably the worst service I've ever experienced in a restaurant. I politely contacted the restaurant to discuss several days later, and they never responded to my message.
No comment
No comment

The atmosphere was lively, service was great and caring. The steaks were perfectly cooked and tasted amazing, and they use a hot plate so the meat stays warm. My only gripe is that we spent 30 bucks on 2 sides and they were very small in comparison to other restaurants. 30 bucks for a small bowl of mashed potatoes and mushrooms is wild to me lol. The steaks and drinks were worth the money. But definitely skip the sides, especially if it's a date.

We were so looking forward to this restaurant, but were sadly disappointed.  Service was painfully slow with an hour wait between courses.  They made a mistake on one of the dishes.  The chicken was dry with a watery sauce. Two members of the party came down with stomach problems after eating the shrimp scampi.  It is a beautiful restaurant and the drinks are good, so just skip the food.
No comment

Neighborhood's gem. It's always packed and difficult to find a table without a reservation, every time I go there I end up sitting by the bar and love it. Great ambiance, tasty food and friendly bartenders.

Yes! So happy to finally try Gage & Tollner 2.0 and it couldn't have been better. The service was above and beyond, even though they were busy, our server was warm, attentive and top notch (we commented that we loved the wine, he even brought the bottle for us to get the info!). And the food? Amazing!! Oysters, Parker rolls, mushrooms (maybe tempura style) to start, then fried chicken + tilefish (something different:) plus the famous Baked Alaska. So happy they're taking reservations and to finally eat here

I guess I fall into the category of old enough to remember this restaurant in it's later glory, but young enough to post a review here. My family has been dinning here since before I was born. I remember my parents would rave about the she crab soup when talking to friends and family. They would talk about the gas fueled lighting which I also found interesting. When I tried this soup for the first time, I had an emotional experience. When my wife and I first started dating, I took her here and we both ordered the soup. At that time the only gas lights were wall sconces, but the she crab soup was still mind-blowingly amazing. It was so good that you felt the need to tell other people. The restaurant closed before we had a chance to return a second time. We were all surprised by the closure. We thought this place would last forever. Then a couple of weeks ago, I was poking around online and found out about the reopening. I was quick to make a reservation. I was happy to see that everything looks pretty much the same. It's an absolute time capsule indeed. The only thing different was the young staff and patrons. I remember being one of the youngest in the restaurant before the closing, now I'm almost the oldest. We had arrived early, so we sat at the bar for cocktails which were very well executed. This gave us some needed time to soak up the well preserved surroundings. I had us added to the waiting list for the sunken harbor club upstairs, but was notified a few minutes later via text that the wait was over 2 hours. When we sat down I noticed the menu had different selections, but the she crab soup was kept a tradition. I ordered the soup. My wife had doubts about the soup being as good considering the current world situation, so she chose another option. I was hoping to prove her wrong. Well...the soup was good, but nothing like what I remembered. I let her have a taste. She knew just by looking at it that it wasn't going to be the same. She had the same opinion after she tried it. It didn't have the impact of what we remembered. The previous version was really that good, and was an experience in itself. Fortunately the rest of the food items ordered were indeed very good. The service had it's ups and downs. It took a nose dive during coffee service. No sugar or spoons were brought when the coffee was served. I asked for these items, and only one spoon came, along with sugar. As I was paying the bill, the sunken harbor hostess came over to let us know that a table was available. This little upstairs spot is not to be missed. Work out the minor kinks in the service, and please please please fix the soup.

We decided to come here before moving out of New York and had an incredible dinner / overall experience. We decided to eat at the bar downstairs and the bartender, Lucky, was great and made some of the best drinks I've had in awhile. We ordered the oysters, olive bread, split a salad, steak, sides and dessert. We also went to the upstairs bar after dinner before heading home and it was great. Atmosphere, service and food were fantastic and we'll definitely come back with friends.

Downtown Brooklyn has become a popular place to live, and there is no shortage of well heeled patrons nearby. Re launch an historic restaurant and you will have instant success. Gage and Tollner has become too popular, and it is difficult to produce high quality food at a high volume. My most recent dinner there proved that point. Let's begin with my Beef Tartar. It arrived no more than four minutes after I placed my order. The Tartar was dull, and it lacked  necessary spice. My Pork Shank wasn't any better. It lacked spice, and the Polenta was lumpy. Wines by the glass were tasty, but the pour was stingy. Our server was attentive, but the noise level was deafening.
No comment

The food wasn't that good. We ordered a medium rare steak that came out medium. And the sauces that came with the steak weren't the best pairing. For example one of them was a sweet bbq sauce. Also got a bone marrow appetizer that was too heavy and oily. Service was good though. But for the price point, i would go elsewhere.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
one of the great iconic restaurant in NYC. superb service and new york vibe. TBone for two was juicy. After dinner go upstairs Sunken Harbor club bar for cocktails.
Honestly, went for my gf bd. Vibes yes food yes drinks yes service yes. Place was great and made me feel rich. Parker house rolls . Steak . My gf says remember to mention the martini.
Went here for my birthday with a small group, great place, helpful staff, delicious food and cocktails

DO NOT pay $10 for these Parker house rolls. They are good and most restaurant offer better for free. I had he crab cake (very good) and the roasted chicken (meh).  Over priced for the quality of the food.
No comment
I went to Gage and Tollner's years ago when I was little. It was great to see it reopened and the place has such a nostalgic feel. Food and drinks were great.
Exceptional service. Food was fantastic. Ambience was great. Would definitely come back.

Man, all the hype. Look, it's not all negative. My martini was well made and we enjoyed the parker rolls. But that's where the good things I have to say ends. Their food was expensive and below average... not just for the price point either. Just plain below average. So sad...

Lucky gave us a meal of a lifetime here between his drinks, conversation and fantastic service. Prices seem a tad steep until you get you dish and say "oh, okay, yeah, worth it." Don't overlook the Parker house rolls and Schiff's baked Alaska is not to be missed either. Frankly, try to eat everything bc it's all great. Just be prepared to spend, but you get what you pay for here.
No comment
We had an amazing time! Great energy in the restaurant, staff was incredibly professional and the food was outstanding. Cocktails were perfect
Food was pretty good, not the best steak that I have had but not awful. They need to step up their appetizers and desserts though.

Make sure to get your reservation a month in advance! Loved the ambiance and the service was great. We went with a group of 4 and just did family style which I recommend so you can try a little bit of everything (:

Sadly, THE FOOD (!) at this expensive steak house was the most disappointing part of our night.  The drinks were fine, the service impeccable (hat tip to Nick G), and the place is wonderful.  But the ribeye for two was extremely fatty (!) and thisclose to raw (when we specifically asked for 'a healthy medium'), and not cooked much more after we sent it back. The portions of potatoes and spinach- while ok- were quite small.  I can't tell you how disappointed we were-
No comment
No comment

The on line hype is  misleading- pictures not accurate for table settings- arrived for reservation Saturday- it was a mob scene - packed 2 deep bar - many tables added to floor- extremely congested - booths never available - inept front desk and snooty servers- the ghosts of the old fine dining establishment must be horrified - noise level precludes enjoyable dinner conversation- don't go unless you enjoy elbow to elbow noisy hash house "dining". We walked out on being seated in this disappointment. One star is an exaggeration.

A lovely meal in a beautifully restored place. The ambiance transports you to another time. It's just grand in every way. The whole experience exceeded our expectations. Our server offered wonderful recommendations and was attentive throughout. We split several items, perfect for two. The Parker house roles came piping hot and buttery. We split the oysters Rockefeller-- I will savor these for a long time. Hot, herbaceous, delicious. Our main was the whole sea bass with Swiss chard gratin and a side of onion rings and mushrooms. Yes, it's a steakhouse but the whole fish is divine. Those onion rings make my mouth water even the next day.
This place is a 20 out of 10! Their rolls, steak, drinks- top notch! Andrew was our waiter and he was the best! I'll be back soon!

Historic and so carefully restored. The staff was kind and they were good stewards of the place's lore, transporting us back to the 19th Century. We stuck with appetizers and small bites -- the Caesar salad was crisp and garlicky, the seared foie was luxurious and silky, and the baked clams were briny and fresh. The stunner was dessert: a coconut layer cake that was buttery, almost savory, and not too sweet, with the fluffiest texture. The pastry chef, Caroline Schiff, was nominated for a James Beard award and her skill really showed!

Beautiful restaurant. Really nice and helpful wait staff. Great cocktails given with sidecars. The food was good, but just good. Nothing was spectacular or stood out. For its price it isn't totally worth it for me, I'd prefer going to another steakhouse. But it's overall a nice dining experience if you aren't a total foodie.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Really takes you back in time, and the food is amazing. Make sure you get a mortgage before you go here. Pricey, but very very good. Ill go again soon, when I win the lottery.

A meal at Gage and Tollner is truly exceptional. I took family from out of town and we were all blown away. The space is big and comfortable (although a little loud), the service is relaxed but attentive and the food was great. Highly recommend the baked Alaska, ALL of their breads and the mushroom appetizer.
No comment
No comment

Gage and Tollner serves the classics in a present and refined way. Appetizers inspire and delight - even more than the entrees. Special recognition to the potato pave with caviar. Though, the porterhouse is divine and better than any other renowned New York City steak house. Their cocktail menu may look small but the only thing you could ever want is their perfect martini. Come here for special occasions and/or  whenever you can get a reservation.

We stopped in here for a late-cocktail on a Sunday evening and what a find! Old school bar and restaurant. Friendly bartenders. The martinis were perfection as were the oysters. Cold, clean, and delicious.  Would love to stop back for dinner the next time we are in the area.

Amazing food and drinks here. Everything is very buttery without feeling greasy. High quality stuff here. The restaurant is packed on a Saturday night. We made reservation at 6pm and we didn't have to wait for our table. Our server was  very friendly and overall service was very good. We ordered the sour brandy and sloe gin fizz as our cocktail and both were balanced and delicious. We told the server we want to share all the food and they split the soup or gave us share plates... perfect! We had the she crab soup, clam boil, ny steak with side of onion rings and pork pot pie. Check out my photos. Honestly everything hit a home run. The steak comes with three different sauces all so good. I think the steak was my favorite, definitely order that. At the end the bill came to about $115 a person with tip. I really love the ambient and love that they kept all the 1800s  historical detail and made it come back to life. The only thing I'll say is our server didn't tell us about the dinner specials but told the next table....maybe she thought we were regulars. Also avoid sitting at the two tops right next to the big table at the kitchen end, servers keep bumping into us. No big deal still five stars.

I would compare the experience to hunger games catching fire. The night started strong but had a poor ending reminiscent to the movie. Initially the bar was set high the moment we entered. The setting had a gorgeous interior. The chandeliers and mirrors have been in place since the opening in the 19th century. To kick off we ate some delicious bread and Caesar salad. I thought this restaurant was in deserving of a 5 star title until the entrees came out. We were served some chewy steak, for a moment I thought I was chewing some mint gum. Double mint, juicy fruit, 5 gum, Extra? Jokes aside it took minutes to chew. We then had some mediocre fried chicken. I mean seriously stick that in a kfc bucket and I'm not noticing that much of a difference. Overall not bad, good actually but there are some steps to be taken to seek 5 stars.

Just there with my "steak group " for our 60th dinner together. What a joy to be back at such a storied Brooklyn eatery.  Great service and great food.  Definitely would return.   Keep up the tradition!
No comment
No comment
No comment

Gage & Tollner is back! Our party of three tasted many dishes, including the spectacular steak for 2. Cooked to perfection. The staff was super friendly. The restaurant was restored to its original elegance after a string of awful commercial chain stores.
This restaurant does everything well, dinner on Friday evening of Labor Day weekend. The restaurant was at capacity but service did not suffer. The Baked Alaska is not to be missed.

My daughter and I went for a pre graduation celebration. We saw "before" photos and they did an amazing job of revitalizing this gorgeous historic location. The food was delicious. We had she crab soup, shrimp cocktail to start. I followed with steak and my daughter had friend chicken. Each dish and side was perfectly and seasoned, cooked and prepared. We asked the bartender to surprise us with a citrus mocktail and it made me want to be beachside on a tropical island. Perfect combination of (all freshly squeezed) lemon, mostly lime with a splash of pineapple and his magic mix of flavored tonics. Perfect balance of tart and but not overtly sweet. Liz, the general manager was so warm and welcoming and the service was amazing. So impressive, especially since they just opened on April 15th. Highly recommend and I'll be returning with friends and family for sure.

Simply amazing. It's a splurge so be prepared to pay for an incredible experience. We got the oysters (fresh and delish), wedge salad (lighter but great dressing), hen of the woods mushrooms (fried which was not our favorite prep), veal chop (perfect), and the beef tartare special which was our favorite. Not sure when bar seating opens-should hopefully be soon!-so we want to go back for drinks and snacks at the bar. The landmarked interior takes you back and is true New York City history!

We've been following all the updates and we're so excited for their Grand opening, finally! The food was great, we ordered The shrimp scampi that came with these little ricotta dumplings that just melted in your mouth, the rolls, Bone-in- ribeye cooked perfectly, Friend chicken with hush puppies, cocktails, Oysters Rockefeller, Coconut cake, Creamed Spinach, OMG the Butter roasted has Browns were incredible, and the crab cake. We literally wanted to order everything  We nearly caught our kid licking his plate-that good! The service, space, and just literally everything was perfect. We left feeling so damn good!
Food and service were very good.  But don't expect to have a conversation.  It gets very very noisy.   Look forward to their expanding into lunch.  Hopefully a quieter experience.

Went here with some friends for a late dinner and had a great time. Our waiter Teddy was very kind and knowledgeable and helped us make some excellent choices for dinner. Highly recommend getting the crab cake, it was 10/10
Food was fabulous!  I would highly recommend this restaurant expect the server's lack of attention, lack of service  and attitude ruined our entire experience.

Coming to the reopened Gage & Tollner was a trip down memory lane: I remember coming here as a child on trips to NY, and a lunch as a grownup before it closed.  The interior was astonishingly preserved and pretty much what I remembered sans the gaslights.  Ambiance plays no role in my 3 star rating: that honestly is for the price, which I thought was high for the overall quality and quantity of the food. Service and the menu are old school with an update.  I had an extremely perfect martini to start, along with the she-crab soup, which honestly wasn't so perfect at $19: it tasted delicious but there was a distinct dearth of crab.  The Parker House rolls almost made up for it, but $8 is a bit steep for 4 rolls.  Husband had the clams casino - also kinda pricey and the clams were small, but very tasty.  For my main, I had the skate wing, which I liked a lot, and there was a decent amount of fish on the chop, so I didn't feel it was overpriced at $28.  Husband got the fried chicken, which was very good, but $27 for fried chicken?? Our friends shared a shoulder of some sort of meat, and enjoyed that, but said it was a little fatty.  Food was pretty slow to come out; I don't know if that was because we were there relatively soon after it opened or if it was due to the place being packed and perhaps not having enough staff.  I didn't really mind because we hadn't seen our friends since before the pandemic and much catching up was taking place, but under other circumstances, it might have been annoying.  I will definitely give G&T another go, but it clearly won't be a place for everyday dining.

Atmosphere, appetizers and service were terrific. Big disappointment on the steak offerings, though.  For a place called a chop house, I expected to be able to get a filet mignon (not offered) or a rib eye (offered, but only in a size 28 ounces or larger!). I settled for a sirloin, and while it was cooked perfectly medium rare, I really didn't enjoy it as much as when I go to any of my regular steak houses. And having to pay $10 for four Parker House rolls is a bit much.  Had they been delivered as "just a regular part of a meal" I would have been favorably impressed. Having to pay for them, and how much we paid for them, left me with a pretty bad impression.
Loved everything, except noise: extremely loud. The management should try to do something about it.
No comment

I took my boyfriend to this restaurant for our anniversary, and I must say.. amazing service ! Food was amazing, especially the steak they cooked the medium well perfectly. The baked Alaskan is by far my fav dessert on the menu, it's a must try!

My boss would take me here for vendor lunches when I was an Assistant Buyer for A&S on Fulton Street way back in 1984!  This is a top notch, very classy restaurant that serves incredible food and perfect cocktails, of which we had way too many in the middle of the day back then!

It's a reason not to leave the neighborhood. Being able to stop in and eat a casual meal (the fried chicken is outrageous) at the bar when it opens or making a reservation for a more formal dinner. You have to come often to get to taste it all.
Excellent. Setting, service, and taste were top class. House rolls, crab cake, fluke crudo, pork pot pie, risotto, and baked alaska. Everything was so good.
No comment
No comment

Good LORD this place is worth the hype. Had the Parker rolls (delicious but could have skipped them) followed by the best fried chicken I've had in my entire life, and all topped off with the chocolate torte. Fantastic food, service and ambience - just the most perfect touches of history and elegance without trying hard at all - all around a well-deserved A+
No comment

After so many years hearing about Gage & Tolbert, and wanting a new experience, we tried this storied restaurant - and we were disappointed in much of the food. The best items were the raw clams and shrimp cocktail. The roasted tomatoes were just okay (and that's being generous). The whole black bass was over-salted, not filleted, but fresh. I make a better NY strip steak at home. The cut was supermarket quality, but a bit thicker. The potatoes and the two different creamed spinachs were awful and all came out cold. I don't know what the owners thought these terrible side dishes added to anyone's enjoyment - other than saying to themselves "let's try different recipes than other restaurant so everyone knows we're not anyplace else." And so... they went with "god-awful."  As for ambiance, it was a bit disappointing. It looked somewhat authentic, but so does a saloon in Disney World. The place was so loud, we had to shout to talk to each other. We tried it. We just didn't think it was worth the $290 (without cocktails) for two. Call me tough, but fair.

The experience was classic! The decor was everything you would expect from this establishment.  The server, Daniel  was super efficient and friendly.  I had the Ribeye with the mixed greens and hash browns,  and everything was exquisite.  But the carmelized peach tart was EVERYTHING! The new owners have definitely revised a beautiful landmark in Brooklyn.  If you are in the downtown Brooklyn area,  you must attend.  It's definitely worth it.

Visited Brooklyn for the weekend and had this place on our list (which received amazing reviews and on many 'best of' lists). Incredible from start to finish. Just walking thru those revolving doors will get you excited for what's inside, which is also amazing front to back. The vibe is perfectly classic, yet electric as soon as you walk in and you're greet by staff who makes you feel right at home. We arrived early but we were able to get a drink while we waited for our table, which they transferred to our table so we didn't have to close out twice. Both the food and menu selection were perfect for my liking. I only wish I had a larger stomach so I could have tried more. In addition to the oysters and the parker house roll, the hash brown was INSANELY good and would have stolen the show but the dry aged ribeye (to share) was one of the best I've ever had. The cocktails were perfectly made, and the sidecar they give was a fun treat which actually makes them relatively cheap if you consider the amount you get. They have all the classics and then some, including a "perfect martini" there which is hard to come by. The vibe, food, drink, and people - I could sit there for days on end just soaking it all in. The staff were incredible from reception, bar, and wait. All very helpful and informative and even gave recommendation of what else to do in Brooklyn during our stay. All in all a great price for a fine dining chop house. Worth every penny and then some. As if that wasn't all great enough, we were able to visit the Sunken Harbor Club upstairs after the meal - worthy of a visit in its own right. The space is incredible with a well curated menu offering - check it out.
No comment
No comment

The food was quite good, nice generous portions and many of the traditional classics are still on the menu.  But unfortunately, a major setback for myself, and our party, was the unbearable sound level.   Gage and Tollner was never like this in the past, it was an elegant dining sanctuary, and I'm not about to shout to have a conversation, or to constantly lean towards someone to hear or to be heard.  It's apparent that additional seating has been added, and despite the good food, it was not worth having my ears assaulted.  The four of us could not wait to get out of there.

I was disappointed by my mediocre and over-priced meal at Gage and Tollner, especially after the great NYT review.  The fried hen-of-the-woods mushroom appetizer tasted only of tempura batter.  The caesar salad was bland.  The $58 strip steak was under-seasoned and had an unpleasant look and texture, like it had been cooked sous-vide.  The cheeses on the cheese plate were small, dry, and unappealing.  Some highlights:  the fluke crudo, the crab soup, the whole roasted fish.  The waiter was nice and helpful.  The room is attractive.  But for a meal that came to $500 for 3 people (with cocktails), I was distinctly underwhelmed.  Not deserving of the hype!

Absolutely brilliant. Food was divine especially the Skate. Our server was lovely - the wine was gorgeous - I had a lovely evening here. If I could have booked more easily (always fully booked) and if the boss lady checking my ID and Vaccine had been a little less stern and bit friendlier, I would've given 5 stars. Great experience.

The space is beautiful and the service was excellent but unfortunately these two things could not make up for the uninspired menu and very steep prices. We desperately need more "nice" restaurants in our area but I can't see this one lasting unfortunately. Yes, many are on a low or no carb diet...but don't penalize the rest of us by charging for bread. Really wanted to like this place but can't imagine coming back anytime soon.
Packed house. A historic location and a restaurant with a storied past. The are celebrating 125 years in business albeit it closed for a few years but reopened. Service and food  were excellent
No comment
Uninspiring and tasteless menu.  Only thing which I liked was the history.  Avoid this over priced steak house.

What a fabulous night out!  The Gage and Tollner team welcomed us warmly and seated us immediately.  The space is beautiful with so many of the original architectural details.  The menu is both classic and contemporary.  The highlights for our group: a Ribeye steak cooked to perfection, the monk fish, asparagus gribiche - and the Hen-of-the wood mushrooms!  Desserts were wonderful - we shared the Baked Alaska, Coconut Cake and the Malted Milk Chocolate Torte.  Our servers were first class. We will be back and can't wait to book a party on the second floor.

Gage and Tollner encompasses the very best of a classic NYC restaurant experience in Brooklyn. While much of the menu has a very old school feel, there are a lot of updated selections as well. The service was excellent. We had the rib-eye and it was made to a very high standard and seasoned exceptionally well. The hash brown might have been the most indulgent and luxurious presentation of a potato that I've ever had. The drinks are served generous portions with an excellent martini. Gage and Tollner is expensive, but I feel that the quality of food, service and atmosphere justify it. I look forward to coming back and trying the Baked Alaska!

The waitstaff was inattentive and made lots of mistakes on our order, all of which they blamed on the kitchen staff, with whom we had no relationship. On top of bad service, this steakhouse actually ran out of steak, something our server told us only after we placed our order. Food quality was C+. Not great, not horrible. Cocktails were the only redeeming quality. But, unless everyone in your party weighs less that 110 pounds, forget about sitting a party of 4 at one of their tiny, cramped booths. For the 4 of us, we spend nearly $800 on $150 of service and quality. If you're inclined to spend $200 per person for a nice meal, go somewhere else.
So happy Gage & Tollner is back! Great food, service and warm hospitality in a beautiful setting. Simply a lovely experience.

A delightful dining experience! Service and pacing were excellent, cocktails well-made, and the food was delicious. And of course the dining room is stunning. I kind of understand the noise issue that others have complained about, but to me it seemed about as loud as any other busy NYC restaurant. I also appreciated that we were not rushed at all, since many restaurants these days try to get you in and out as fast as possible. I would recommend the Parker house rolls, clam belly broil, roasted skate wing, NY strip, and cheesecake. Definitely a great choice for a special occasion!
No comment
Great takeout. Food was solid.Drinks even better. Hope they open for real soon. The place looks gorgeous from the brief time I was there to pick up my food.

A beautiful, luxurious space with hugely expensive entrees that is degraded by a terrible, unprofessional staff, a lack of ANY dress code, and horrendous acoustics. My recommendation: Walk in, look around, appreciate the restoration, then walk out.

Wonderful experience. Really excellent service, exquisite food and interesting menu both savory, sweet and drinks.  Graceful blend of old classics with a clear signature style. Approachable, clean and classic flavor profiles. Beautiful ambiance. We looking forward to returning. Really enjoyed our experience from beginning to end.

What a treat. Returned to my old neighborhood and my fiance got a reservation here for my birthday weekend. When you walk in, you are instantly transported to another time. Beautiful chandeliers and an old-fashioned bar await you. Then you start to eat. I had the mussels soup to start, which was one of the best soups i've ever had. Meaty mussels and a tasty broth that tasted like the white wine you often find in your mussels with a bit more sweetness that was well portioned.  We also ordered a beet salad which was delicious with pistachio and ricotta mixed in.  For the main course, i had the Monkfish which was also a good size and mixed in an artichoke barigoule with potatoes and peas (it comes with bacon but i don't eat bacon and holding it did not diminish the dish in any way).  My fiance ordered the Oysters Rockefeller (something you don't see anymore) appetizer as a main. Also well portioned and excellent. We washed it down with a Rob Roy for me and a Champagne Cocktail for her. A perfect meal with a Chevre Cheesecake to complete it that, due to its goat cheese base, was not overly sweet or heavy like regular cheesecake often is.   The service was impeccable.  My water was rarely drained and the table was cleaned after every course with seemingly endless waiters coming over to take care of us.  All in all, a highly recommended old-fashioned, classy dining experience.
We ate at G&T tonight for the first time in many years. The new owners have done a beautiful restoration of the restaurant, the food was delicious and the service was impeccable.

Had a lovely dining experience here on a busy Friday night. The host was very friendly and shared the history of the restaurant and the designs while we waited for our table. The place was packed but service was very prompt and all the servers were attentive. The only downside is the noise, it is very loud. We were a party of two but we could not hear each other. Conversation was very difficult with the noise. The food was very well prepared and presented. We started with the Parker rolls, crispy on the outside but divinely fluffy and hot on the inside. I had the she crab soup, smooth texture with very few pieces of crab, mellow flavor with a hint of sweetness from the sherry. I had the fried chicken w/ hush puppies. It was amazing! Juicy and full of flavor with a nice crisp. I'm going back for that chicken. My friend had the roasted sea bass. We both enjoyed the fresh flavor, it was stuffed with fresh oregano and was delicious. We had the baked Alaska for dessert. It was a very large serving, the ice cream flavors were tart a good compliment to the sweetness of the merengue. Portions were adequate, we ended up bringing food home. I truly enjoyed the food and the service. It was worth the money the only reason it's not a 5 star review is because of the noise.
Cool cuz ya gotta love you old school- but damn ya gotta deliver and they don't - but for friendly and helpful staff  I'd  have given em 2 stars - great cocktails
Took 1 hour and 40 minutes to get mains on the table. Service was missing in action. Food was okay but really not okay at $440.

A gem of a spot. I'm glad I got to go for lunch before it inevitably becomes the next hardest spot to get a reservation. I visited for lunch and was greeted by the loveliest and most eclectic of atmospheres. I love that every week the menu changes and that their ingredients are fresh! I thoroughly enjoyed everything  on their lunch menu. The value for what you get is amazing! Definitely will be back for dinner
No comment

Oh it's just the loveliest hole in a Brooklyn wall. The space is so inviting, the staff is cool and hot and queer and hip and friendly, and the food is always wildly impressive. Perfect for a celebration, or just a night out with loved ones. Cannot recommend this place enough.

Had the best time reuniting with 5 of my best friends from college. Such a fun concept and cool space. Was gonna have my birthday party here last December but they closed for covid, so I'm glad I was finally able to make it out for dinner.

This was such a well done beautifully executed experience. I truly did feel like I was at a dinner party at one of my close friends houses. The dinnerware is all mismatched and hand picked. Gives a nice chill, homey vibe. The food all came out timely and everything was really enjoyable. There's only one seating per night at 7:30 and this allows everyone in the restaurant to really take their time and also engaged with the servers and the head chef. We started out with a flatbread that was topped with warm goat cheese I believe, pears and arugula. Then we had a delicious fall squash based soup with pepitas on top and a delicious herb olive oil. Next we had a beef roast with mashed potatoes topped with radicchio  and olives. This was so flavorful it tasted like it was slow cooked all day. And to top off, molten chocolate cake for dessert. My absolute favorite part of the meal was chatting with the chef. The menu is set weekly on Mondays when they shop for whats in season. This makes everything taste really intentional. You don't have to spend time on picking something from the menu, you can just enjoy yourself!

Such a pretty spot & perfect for brunch. This spot offers a strict pre-fixe menu that changes based on chef's choice & seasonality. Had the sweetest sweet peas as a starter & some duck breast with chili oil + ramp (instead of scallion) pancakes. For dessert we had cornmeal pudding with candied mangoes. Wondering if this is a BYOB spot, just missed some spirited drinks but not complaining. They also served up some very refreshing iced coffee perfect for 90 degree day.

Came here for a birthday party and absolutely LOVED it! I wouldn't be surprised if it's pretty hard to get a reservation in an average evening because it's so small but I love spots like this that have limited seating and limited space, everything's so well curated and the restaurant itself is absolutely adorable. The staff was all so lovely and made the evening that much better. It's definitely a spot that lot of locals love but even if you're not from the area it is a great experience that I would highly recommend!

What a lovely charming place. I love the atmosphere and I love the pre fix. Great concept! Highly recommended! And if you have the chance to have their sourdough bread, what a treat!

Such a lovely concept for a restaurant. Truly a hidden gem in the area. The chef himself came out to thank us for coming and they even adjusted the menu to make it vegan for me. Everything was delicious but I have to say the japanese sweet potato was to die for! Highly recommend.

We came here for brunch, we loved how the place was decorated, how kind the staff was and people being true to the "dinner party" concept which was talking to strangers! The food was incredible and quite a good portion for $22. I can't wait to come back to try their dinner! I highly recommend !!

Cute concept but the food was incredibly lackluster. It felt like something a not particularly talented at cooking friend would feed you
Fantastic! Homey, beautiful space, delightful staff, and the most delicious food. A great communal space and place to return to again & again as the menu shifts.

Food and service were amazing!! Vibe is so cozy. The only thing I'd mention is that the drinks were really expensive but the prices weren't listed in the menu. We ended up paying just as much for drinks as we did for the meal, which was a bit of sticker shock. But I will definitely come back and either BYO (which I saw others do) or just ask ahead of time :)

Couldn't ask for a more authentic home-cooked meal by the nicest people ever. Our 3rd visit. Love you guys. See you soon.

A New York gem. Really good food, adorable ambience, nice staff. A great neighborhood place. Their lunch picnic boxes are gourmet but for the same price as you can buy basically anything -- 16 or 18 bucks. Pretty sweet deal! This spot is new to the neighborhood, support them!
dinner party is an absolute delight. Every menu is thoughtful and scrumptious. Their sourdough goes OFF. Feels like home away from home. Also All the staff are really hot.
Impeccable service, food, and vibes. The owner and staff care so much about this place, and you can taste it in the food!!!

An amazing bar that is getting attention around the world. Voted #6 bar in the world in a short time since they first opens says a lot. My friend raved about this place and I didn't believe him until I went myself and tried it out. Their hot honey chicken sandwich is one of the best chicken sandwich I ever had! Yes, it's better than Popeyes and Chik-Fil-A (sorry not sorry) Their backroom cocktails are unique and amazing. The names of the cocktail confused me a bit but once the bartender explained the meaning, it made sense. We had 5 cocktail drinks and a DCP shot. If I have to give my favorites, it would be the NY Beet Salad and Japanese Cold Noodle. As strange as the names sound, it is really good. The staffs are awesome, friendly and bartenders are equally the same. They know their drinks and it was enjoyable watching them make the drinks (sat at the counter) Definately reserve as soon as possible! Reservations gets filled up quickly. There is a wait outside for the front area serving cocktails on tap (and offers food too) Overall, I would absolutely come back, as long as I get through Resy!

If you're into Old Fashioned's, the Mango Sticky Rice is the way to go! I went with a large group and we all ordered two rounds and tried each others drinks. They were are excellent!

Was only able to get a reservation for 11pm (after staying up until midnight and refreshing the page exactly on the dot), but this spot is well worth the hard reservation. The front room is small and unassuming, but the back room is very modern and dark, with warm lighting. We ordered the mango sticky rice and the Japanese cold noodle (rec from a friend). The nápense cold noodle was DELICIOUS! Seriously a must get because it was so refreshing and interesting. I don't love dark liquor so I really shouldn't have ordered the mango sticky rice. It had interesting flavor but was too sweet and strong for me. Will definitely come back to try the chicken next time!

Drinks were incredible. My fiancé and I ordered all of them to split and each one is well worth the try. My favorites were the Japanese Cold Noodle and Red Eye Gravy. The DCP house shot was also amazing. We ordered a few. The food was pretty awesome. Got the popcorn chicken and mousse, the hot honey and salted egg yolks sandwiches and then the two desserts. We loved the sandwiches so much that we ordered a hot honey sandwich to go. The pudding is pretty large. Service was great. If you plan to drink drink like we did, put your order in when your close to being done because the drinks obviously take a while to make because they are crafted by kings and require time to perfect for a full bar.

Fried chicken sandwiches and fancy unique cocktails? Yes please x2. We somehow managed to nag a reservation for the backroom and were so excited to try these drinks! I got the key lime which was a dessert in a drink and captured the taste so well. Even the odder ones like Japanese cold noodle were pleasantly palatable, didn't think I'd be a fan. Chicken sandwiches may seem like a weird pairing with a cocktail but the hot honey one is a must-try -- trust me. I already know that I must come back to try more of the drink and food menu here (if I can get a res)!

Excellent fried chicken and cocktails. Unique drinks and the chicken brings out a lot more of the flavor. Surprisingly blends well.

Came by around 6 PM on a Wednesday and waited for around 30 minutes to be seated in the front room. Sadly we weren't able to wait for the back room since it was closed for a private event. As for the food, we ordered the baby gem lettuce, popcorn chicken, and hot honey sandwich. My favorite was the popcorn chicken! It had great flavor and was crispy but did not leave me with an oily/heavy feeling at all. The baby gem lettuce was unique, love the grated cheese. The chicken in the hot honey sandwich was delicious as well but I do wish had more unique flavor or a special sauce after having the popcorn chicken. Overall, solid food and definitely want to come back to try the cocktails!!!

Alright so we came on a Saturday night around 5 and there was a long line. We waited like an hour to get into the front room and put our names down for the back room. The front room is not worth it as all the cocktails are on tap. The food is very MEH like we tried the hot chicken sandwich, cucumbers, and Big Mac and found it all underwhelming. Just come here to put your name down for the back room or make a reservations because the drinks back there were awesome. We got a normal whisky sour which my boyfriend said was definitely above par than normal ones you make at home, I loved the beet salad (perfect creaminess and earthiness without because too much), the French toast was also creamy and almost coffee like without having any coffee and even though was sweet, did not taste too much to me, and we also got the aviation which was very refreshing!

This. Place. Is. The. Bomb. It was really hard to get a reservation here, but I set up my Resy notifications and was determined to make it work on my most recent trip to New York. We luckily got a spot at 11pm, but unfortunately didn't realize the kitchen closes at 11! Will have to make another stop next time to try their fried chicken - definitely make sure you go before 11 if you're hungry! The drinks were incredible. My favorite was the key lime pie, it was like nothing I've ever had before and absolutely delicious (even though my friend and I aren't fans of key lime pie, we LOVED this drink). The sesame flavor in the cold noodle drink was also to die for. This place is amazing and I can definitely understand why it gets the rave reviews!

I am utterly confused by the popularity of this place. The chicken sandwiches were incredibly underwhelming, messy and sloppily put together with overwhelming flavors and chicken that wasn't crispy, the cocktail was very mid and overpriced. Restaurant opens at 5.00pm I got there at 4.50pm and there was a long line in front of restaurant already. It took us 1 hours to get into the restaurant. We were so lucky that they got space at the back room. We ordered cold noodles(the most popular one), Cold pizza, Mango sticky rice, and French toast. The best one was French toast. We also ordered Salted egg chicken sandwich and Liver mousse, they both are amazing!! Overall, good experience but I will comeback only if we have reservations

The manager is incredibly rude and argumentative. The service is slow and there's no care for the guest. The drinks were weak and wait were not worth the hype.

The line is usually long at DCP and it's hard to get a reservation so make sure to grab a spot early if you plan on going there. Personally, we prefer the Back Room because some of their signature cocktails there were not offered in the Front Room. For drinks, our favorite has got to be their signature Key Lime Pie and of course we couldn't leave without tasting their chicken sandiwches (crispy on the outside, tender and juicy on the inside). Without a doubt, Double Chicken Please lives up to its reputation.

lacking foresight for a reservation? show up with your party at 5pm (expect a line) and put yourself on the waitlist for the Back Room for swanky cocktails. As you wait, eat your feelings out in the Front Room. The honey fried chicken sandwich is guaranteed to temporarily cure any and all existential crises, family drama, breakups, evictions, court orders, you name it.

Another member of my top five spots to get craft cocktails in the nation was awarded to the legendary Double Chicken Please. I have waited hours to get into this establishment, both the front and back experiences. Their cocktail taps upfront and cocktail offerings in the back are out of this world. Our feast included the Hot Honey Chicken Sandwiches [buttermilk, thai basil], a Hot Honey Chicken Sandwich on a Mochi Donut [buttermilk, thai basil], Popcorn Chicken [ginger, white pepper, five spice], Koji Cucumbers [shio kombu, sesame, thai chili] and the cocktails I focused on this time out were the NY Beet Salad [Bombay Sapphire, beet, pineapple, cranberry, mascarpone, yogurt], French Toast [Grey Goose, roasted barley, brioche, coconut, milk, maple syrup, egg], and a Japanese Cold Noodle [Bacardi Superior, pineapple, cucumber, coconut, lime, sesame oil]. That popcorn chicken was the best I've ever had! I learned from my coworker how common a box of that full flavored animal candy is in Chinese convenient stores. My mouth just started watering again thinking of it. Trust me when I say their cocktails taste EXACTLY like their simple names. Fight your way to get in if you can. Pro tip, if you want something completely unique, the owner is always up for a challenge. I'd trust her to make my last sip of medicine on earth.

They have a more extensive menu if you get seated in the back. We came towards closing, but they were kind enough to let us in! (: I just wanted to try their key lime pie since my friend raved about it. She was not wrong!! It is literally the BEST drink i've ever had in my life. It literally tastes like it!! Not too sour not too sweet, and had a pie crust flavor! SO GOOD!

We first tried DCP when they opened during the pandemic and had a pretty cool take-out set that we very much enjoyed. So, we were excited to dine in this time. We decided to take a seat in the Front Room since we mainly wanted the sandwiches and you cannot order those in the Back Room. We ordered the chicken liver mousse + baguette, hot honey chicken sandwich, tofu sandwich, and a couple of cocktails. Everything was delicious, really great flavor combos. We particularly loved the tofu sando the first time, so we knew we had to have it again! The place seems to get pretty busy but at least for the Front Room it's first come, first serve and it moves fast. However, there was a long waitlist for the Back Room, so it'd probably be best to try getting a reservation if you're interested in that instead. Overall, great spot for a casual dinner and creative draft cocktails.

Came here with a friend and they seem to serve different food based on where you sit. They have a front room and a back room. The front room serves sandwiches and tap tails while the back room serves more of dinner entrée typa food with cocktails. We got seated in the back room and ordered a king salmon, oysters and stuffed wings. We were surprised by how tender the salmon was cooked. It literally melts in your mouth and it had so much flavor in it! Also very surprised by how fresh those oysters are that we had to get another round of that. My friend recommended this Japanese cold noodle cocktail drink, at first I was very suspicious of its taste due to the name but it turned out to be SO GOOD that I ordered another round of that as well. Great ambience and service! Will come back to try their chicken sandwich next time

Third time here and now I love this place! They opened during pandemic and they were able to get on the World's Top 50, so very impressive! They have Front Room and Back Room. Both have the same food menu, but the Front Room has what they call taptails, which is more casual and drinks are premade. Back room is more intimate and has more creative cocktails. We got salted egg chicken sandwiches and popcorn chicken for food. From the front room, we got #1(aperol, passion fruit, sparkling wine, soda), #4, (lemongrass shochu, gentian, plum, green tea), and #12 (mocktail - winter melon, oolong, citrus). From the back room, we got key lime pie and NY Beet Salad. Their back room drink menu is all food names! Love the food and the drinks! Highly recommend key lime pie! The line for back room is long without a reservation. We walked in and had to wait over an hour, but it was good that we could order at the front room first for some drinks and food.

My friend and I managed to snag a reservation for the backroom / the coop at 10pm, which was a little late for dinner but no regrets. Food, drinks, and ambiance were so good. I got the cold noodle, she got the mango sticky rice, and then we split the salted egg yolk chicken sandwich and the chicken liver mousse  both of which were SO good. the chicken sandwich was super juicy, with the slightly sweet cucumber pickle strips to break up the (minimal) grease, but the chicken liver mousse kind of stole the show for me. it was really smooth, and had a layer of coffee butter on top that went really well with the richness and fattyness of the liver. flavoring on it was insanely good. the cold noodle was also a drink that was completely new to me, but would definitely get again. it actually tasted almost exactly like a real cold noodle and was very smooth.
Impeccable cocktails. Super creative menu and everything was simply PERFECT!  The bar tenders were amazing - very professional which we appreciate. Excellent service and worth the 3 1/2 hour wait!
No comment

Finally made it here! Came here on a Tuesday night with my friend and was able to get seated in the back room! Heard it was hard to get a table in the back room so we did made it to the restaurant 15mins before they opened and were the first to queue up. They seated the people with RSVP first, the back room got filled pretty fast once we got in. On to the drinks! we had the Japanese cold noodle, mango sticky rice, key lime pie, and the Waldorf salad and can honestly say alll the drinks were AMAZING! The service was on point too! The only let down was the hot honey chicken sandwiches we ordered, it wasn't good at all, the buns were hard. Can't wait to go back to try the rest of the drinks on the menu.

One of a kind cocktail place serving innovative cocktails that taste like delicious food. We sat at the back room and ordered all 8 cocktails on the menu (DCP shot was the only one we didn't try). My favorites are NY beet salad and cold pizza. Both are unique and showcased how creative/unconventional the mixologists are. Cold pizza - literally tasted like cold pizza, I never imagined a cocktail would taste like that. Another dangerous yet delish drink was French toast, it tasted like French toast and I downed it within 5 minutes. Needless to say, I will be back. As a matter of fact, I already made another reservation to come back within a week.

Went there with my mon-drinking daughter and both of were blown away with the amazing drinks and the chicken sandwich.

Wow so impressed with the drinks and service here. My favorite drink was the French Toast. Inevitably dangerous because you don't taste the alcohol and then it creeps up on you later...the drink is sweet and really does taste like French Toast. It's paired with an in-house made chocolate cookie, that's pretty bitter but goes perfectly with the drink itself. The NY Beet Salad is also pretty solid, it's topped with whipped mascarpone + yogurt, which was super interesting but it worked. Also recommend the Japanese Cold Noodle if you are looking for a lighter, crisper tasting drink. Service was A1, and we sat at the bar in the Back house so it was fun getting to see the drinks made right in front of us. We came as a party of 2 on a Tuesday night and waited about 10-15 minutes as a walk-in (no reservation). Highly recommend and hoping to try the food here the next time I come back!

This place was good in 2021-2022 but now they have empty seats and bar areas and they still won't allow patrons inside the store. Very confusing - are they trying to make it more exclusive to while making people freeze out in the cold?

Best bar I've been to. Incredible cocktails and delicious food. Worth the wait for sure!

A creative and interesting place! They have a different menu in the front and the back of the room. Would suggest trying both while you're there. We booked a table in the back and they moved us to the front when we were ready since we had to try the chicken sandwich. The cocktails on tap was an interesting concept as well

DCP is as good as what you have heard. I am more of a fan of the food than of the cocktails. But, I tried as many drinks as I could (responsibly). The cocktails were definitely an experience... but a bit sweet for my tastes... one of each was plenty. I would certainly return for the sandwiches and the pickles - once you have them you will be hooked and want DOUBLE! The staff were great.... Very cordial and made the visit one to repeat ASAP

If I could leave 6 stars I would. We got drinks from the front room and back room on the same night. Every drink blew our mind. It was so crazy I was texting my friends throughout the night to tell them to make sure to come here for the drinks because the drinks here were the best cocktails I've ever had in my life and I'm not exaggerating. We got shots and 5 different cocktails. The highlights for me were the yuzu espresso cocktail, mango sticky rice cocktail, and the Japanese cold noodle cocktail

Dining in the backroom of Double Chicken Please was a unique culinary experience that activated my senses. First, I tried the Key Lime Pie cocktail, which literally tasted like a bite of pie, down to a crust after taste. How?! I also tried the Cold Pizza cocktail. It smelled exactly like a margarita pizza and tasted like tomatoes. Did I love it? No. But am I glad I ordered it and got to experience a drink I have never seen anywhere else? Absolutely! Moving on to the food - everything was incredible. My favorite flavor of the entire evening was the Koji cucumber appetizer. This dish was a fresh explosion of spice and sesame with a perfect crunch. We also got the Popcorn Chicken appetizer that we ate before I even got a chance to take a picture; it was that good! As for the entrée, the Hot Honey chicken sandwich lived up to the hype. It was full of flavor, salt, and a beautiful combination of textures with the fried pickles and chicken. In addition, the ambiance and vibes are on point. The intimate setting and glowing bar lights make this a perfect location for a date. Just make sure you get a reservation in advance!!

Saddened that this place now has the same menu in the front and back restaurant. I visited earlier in the year and had some really great food and beverages, now there's not as much variety outside of chicken sandwiches.

When I was looking up reviews for other restaurants I used reviews for this restaurant as a barometer for whether or not I can even trust Yelp reviews. I'm amazed that DCP would receive anything less than 4 stars. It is the best chicken sandwich I have ever had in my life and literally the best drinks I will probably ever have in my life. I am no expert on mixology but these drinks were SO unique in taste and presentation and DANGEROUSLY smooth. A favorite is the Japanese cold noodle- holy crap it was to die for. Other notable foods: stuffed chicken wings, fried tofu sandwich, bolognese sandwich ALL AMAZING AND MUST TRY. The ambiance is cool and feels exclusive. Our friends made the reservation so I can't speak to that process. Will definitely be coming back here on our next and probably many subsequent visits to New York.

A friend started working here, so we were excited to come and support. What an experience! Fine dining feels with regular NYC prices, we were well taken care of from start to finish. The "Big Mac" macaron dessert was sooooo cute and so intricately crafted. The chicken sandwiches were *chef's kiss* so good, and none of our party of four could decide which one was our favorite. I will say that the salted egg chicken sandwich really did not taste much of salted egg, but the chicken sandwich was good nonetheless. For drinks, any of them are good, but cocktail #3 at the time of the menu (July 2021) was my favorite. Would definitely go with the recommendation of your waiter as there's really not a bad drink to be made in this establishment.

If you're going without reservations, you'll probably have to wait for a counter seat or stand. But the drinks on tap are all delicious and the hot honey chicken sandwich was so so good - perfect balance of sweet and savory with crispy, juicy chicken on a pretzel bun. The place will get busier as the night goes on, but great service and good vibes!

Cute spot with interesting drinks. The restaurant is split between front (informal) and back. I wanted to try the sandwiches so we sat in the front. Drinks were unique with hints of Asian ingredients - teas, winter melon, longan, etc. We ordered the hot honey, salted duck egg and tofu sandwiches. Our favorite was the hot honey. The duck egg had a taste I wasn't used to and the tofu had a delicious peanut sauce but it was missing texture. I would come back for the drinks and sit in the back to see what other foods they have.

What a unique dining experience!  The food was shareable and not simply chicken sandwiches. The drinks were amazing- also shareable. Would dine again here!

Best place to go after dinner! Casual drinks in the front room and amazing vibe for cocktails in the back room. Both drink menus are so creative and delicious! Their chicken sandwiches are the best in Manhattan with hints of Taiwanese cuisine - truly so good that you would want another one! Our server Alfred was so nice and attentive! The menu could be overwhelming but he did a great job explaining the items to us and we were happy with everything we ordered! Definitely will come back regularly!

Pretty incredible place, the food is outstanding, but the drinks hit it out of the park!

Came here for post dinner drinks and it didn't disappoint! The front area sells food and beer. Then there's a back area (which is visible from the front) which is more of a cocktail lounge. Their drinks are very unique and a lot of their cocktails are modeled after food ie French toast and pizza. I had the pizza drink because I wanted something savory. It was very interested and tasted like tomatoes (in a good way). The ambience was gorgeous.

Came for dinner in the back room but after the meal, I really wish I just ate in the front room instead. A fried chicken sandwich would've definitely hit the spot for a fraction of the cost. I ordered the Japanese cold noodle cocktail. They all sounded unusual but this was what was recommended to me by the server. The sesame oil threw the drink off for me. As odd as it sounds, tasted like I was drinking sushi or seaweed. As for food, we ordered what we thought was enough for three people. We had the shiitake mushroom poppers, hen of the woods, a dozen east cape oysters, blue Crystal prowl ceviche, ora king salmon, stuffed chicken wings, and hojicha pudding for dessert. Sounds like a lot of food but it left me feeling unsatisfied and hungry. The only dish I thoroughly enjoyed were the oysters. The salmon was decent with the enoki sauce. I appreciate the creativity with the food but personally it didn't taste good. The most disappointing has got to be the dessert. I'm a huge fan of hojicha but the grapefruit did not work with the pudding at all. Made it extremely bitter and tart while the tea flavor was too potent.

Food tastes below the average. Service are not good.Disappointing experience.will never come back next time.

I'm still dreaming about the popcorn chicken and soba noodle cocktail I had here. I don't know why a Japanese noodle cocktail was something I needed in my life, but this is now the cocktail standard I will hold all other drinks up to. Can't wait to come back and try their other drinks!

Cute spot where they serve chicken sandwiches and also drinks! Each table (small table btw) has a hand sanitizer bottle with a QR code on it for the menu. They have 3 sandwiches on the menu, a hot chicken sandwich, salted egg yolk sandwich and a tomato one with cheese. I got the hot chicken sandwich ($13) and it was good! The chicken was juicy and crunchy! It wasn't too spicy for me. I also tried the ilegal mezcal shot which is mixed with shiso and plum and you can taste the sweetness followed by the smokiness of the shot. I also tried their #4 drink and #5. One had longan, honey, and whiskey while the other had cranberry and lavender. Both drinks were good!

I wanted to go to this place since I always love to eat chicken sandwiches. I ordered the hot honey chicken sandwich. It is my first time coming here. It is super classy inside. There wasnt anyone there when we went. I got it for to go and while we were waiting for the food they served us cold water. I am very pleased. Food came super fast and the staff were nice. The hot honey tasted weird but in a good way. I couldnt stop eating it.
No comment

Been wanting to check out this place, both the front and back menus, as they are distinct. Hard to get a resy for the back, but got a chance to try their awesome fried chicken sandos in the front, and one of their pre-mixed drinks on tap. I got the #5 kavalan whiskey, patron orange, oolong, longan and honey, and it was okay. Would def have preferred to order the fancier drinks in the back. We ordered both fried chicken sandos, the salted duck egg and hot honey. I really expected to like the hot honey one more, but was pleasantly surprised with the salted duck egg, and actually liked it better, as the flavors were so unique! Definitely lived up to the hype and one of the best fried chicken sandwiches I've ever had. Hope to try the back menu one day!

I came here specifically for the salted duck egg yolk sandwich and I ended up get that plus the hot honey sandwich and the chips with a side of salted duck egg yolk sauce . I came here expecting to love the salted egg sandwich only and it exceeded my expectations. And the hot honey was just as high- they are equally amazing!!! So deliciously heart-warming and satisfying. I ate outside in 30-degree temperatures and was so happy. I heard the tofu sandwich is actually also very good with Chef Mark using his grandmother's peanut sauce recipe. Expect menu to expand and some items to change seasonally. Hector at the bar is very helpful and will guide you about the goods!

We had a reservation for the back room. Drinks there were excellent. The couple dishes we got were good. However, I wish they had more serious food options there (especially for people waited for long I imagine). We then moved to the front room for a sandwich. My expectation for drinks was high at this point! They didn't turn out to be as good. The sandwich was ok. Overall, good atmosphere, great drinks at the back, decent for a date!

Amazing drinks and a great atmosphere! The option to have a causal or intimate time is amazing. The front is a great place to have amazing chicken. The back is more intimate and sit down for drinks with friends. Would recommend checking it out!
Great food and great drink, had  great time with my gf and the service was great and ambiance awesome

It was yummy and delivery came still warm and intact. Yummy crispy fried goodness. Tofu sandwich was filling and delicious. Hot honey sandwich was AMAZING! Def a heavy meal so be prepared.

The bar is offering a list of draft cocktails from the tap right now, so the drinks don't look fancy with lots of garnish, but they are still great drinks. #1 is a cold brew based cocktail, with rum to spike it up and apricot to make it smoother and easier to drink. #5 is my better choice with Kavalan whisky, oolong, longan and honey - you can taste all these ingredients in the drink and appreciate how harmonious they are together to give you that oriental impression. The salted duck yolk sauce that come with the sweet potato chips is really good as well (although a bit small in portion - we finished the whole thing before the chips). Overall a really nice experience and would love to come again.

Wow the space is actually super nice! The menu is on the smaller side, with very few options for food, but I ended up getting the Hot Honey sandwich and it was really good! The chicken is extremely tender and flavorful - I couldn't resist finishing this in minutes! They have indoor seating now and didn't seem too busy on the weekends.

One of the best chicken sandwiches I've had in New York! I was apprehensive about about the addition of honey as I'm not a huge honey in savory person, but IT WORKS. Every element of the sandwich down to the pickles makes the sandwich a masterpiece. Would highly recommend stopping here before heading out to LES.
Great space and great food! Salted egg fried chicken sandwich was to die for. Can't wait until the pandemic is over so I can fully experience all the different cocktails selections they have.

Very cool vibes and the drinks were fantastic. The cocktails were inspired by food and each one we ordered blew my mind. I ordered the cold pizza and I was shocked that the cocktail have a savory flavor reminiscent of a day old pizza one buys after a night of drinking.

Great new spot that opened up during the pandemic in the LES. When you walk in, the decor is nice and easy on the eyes. Service is great and friendly. Me and a friend stopped by and had a round of cocktails. Both we had were great and definitely want to come back and try more of the menu.

Delicious, albeit slightly expensive chicken sandwiches. We got both and although they were both good, i preferred the salted duck. The hot honey reminded me of one of those yangnyum korean chicken except on a sandwich and not as flavorful. I also wasnt a big fan of the pretzel bread because it was a bit dry for me.

WOW! Everything about this place was amazing ! First, we had a late reservation so some of our friends couldn't make it but when we arrived, the host didn't give us trouble she immediately said that's fine just give us a minute to adjust the table and that was it. The waitress came up right away took our order for food & drinks. I got the French toast drink and it was so good! Tasted similar to a mudslide minus the slushee texture. I also tasted the cold noodle drink (tasted like a Korean buckwheat noodle dish) and the red eye gravy. The tastes and concepts are very unique and well done! Food wise we got the chicken sandwiches, salted egg and hot honey. We also got the macaroni salad which I was not not particularly a fan of. It tasted a little off for me, similar to when mayo based foods start to turn a little. The table got the pate which they said it was sweeter than what they were used to. Overall a great atmosphere and great drinks !
How do you burn not one but two chicken sandwiches? Can't comment on the cocktails but the chicken sandwiches were horrible.
