I didn't make a dine in reservation but got takeout instead. I decided to go with 4 Hot Honey Chicken sandwiches. The place itself is very modern, sleek and all the waiters were extremely tentative. I would definitely want to sit down and eat here one day! Anyways, the chicken sandwich itself is amazing and it wasn't as greasy as other chicken sandwiches. My friend and I really enjoyed it and we can't wait to come back and enjoy the dine in experience.

I really wish Inga and Alvin didn't hype this spot up so much. I was honestly expecting a life changing chicken sandwich and was a little disappointed. That being said, the salted duck eggs sandwich was packed with umami and their on tap cocktails were very creative!

GN and his restaurant staff are creative with their menu and provide high-quality service. The place is small yet felt modern, clean, and spacious the way they seated people. Their cocktails are uniquely crafted- it's truly an art the way they blend ingredients to create something your taste buds have never tasted before. We tried #2-5 and I think #2 was my favorite (the least sweet, very refreshing) and #4 was by far the most creative/interesting with a blend of tequila, cranberry, lavender and cocoa. The hot honey sandwich is incredible as most have mentioned! Everything down to the dessert has the utmost attention poured into its craftsmanship. This place is a must-visit if you're craving a chicken sandwich or just a unique place to grab drinks
No comment

my friend brought me here after getting dinner together. there was a wait for the back part of the restaurant so we sat in the front part which was completely fine. we came here for the cocktails on tap which was a pretty cool idea and design (since you get to see them pour it right in front of you as it's the main prop as soon as you walk in). the mocktail reminded us of bubble tea- super yummy. we got 4 different drinks in total - i liked all of them besides the cranberry vodka one which was a bit too tart for me. otherwise, i highly recommend this place for the vibes and cocktails! definitely want to come back and try the chicken sandwiches next time haha

Double Chicken Please in Lower East Side is a vibey bar showcasing inventively crafted cocktails and delicious namesake fried chicken sandwiches. We sat in the Back Room which is the reservation-only section of the bar featuring incredible food-inspired cocktails and delicious bites. Our favorites from the night were the Mango Sticky Rice topped with shaved coconut to highlight the nuttiness of the drink, the Buttermilk Biscuit served with an earl gray biscuit, and the Japanese Cold Noodle which was punctuated fragrant sesame oil. For those looking for something more adventurous, the Cold Pizza tastes exactly like it's namesake in liquid form for a wild, savory experience. For dinner we ordered the oysters topped with watermelon, mushroom poppers, prawn ceviche, stuffed chicken wings, and crispy artichokes. We ordered the salted duck egg and hot honey fried chicken sandwiches to go since you're not able to order them in the Back Room and were happy we did as they were among the best fried chicken sandwiches in NYC. Double Chicken Please showcases some of the best mixology we've had the pleasure to try in the city. A great place to go for a date or a start to a night out with friends

We had an amazing experience here. We snagged a reservation on Resy for two and were seated at the bar. Ordered about 3 cocktails each & multiple small plates to share. Not only was the food amazing but also the environment was sleek, modern, and gorgeous. The cocktails were creative & exciting. And our bartender, who I believe was a founder as well, was so attentive & thorough in explaining everything to us. He even gave us a free drink for our anniversary. Cool, fun NYC fine dining at its best.

This spot is a hard fine. The drinks are good but the food menu needs some work. There's not one item on the menu that leaves you satisfied. Is it tasty? Yes. But will you need to go to Congee Village across the street after? Yes.

Double Chicken Please is the spot to try if you are in the area. If you have a craving for chicken sandwiches, you should consider trying. Just a heads up, their menu is super limited. I am not a picky eater, but for those who are and wants a regular chicken sandwich, look elsewhere. For those who are adventurous, they have the salted duck egg sandwich and the hot honey sandwich. We had tried both. I love duck and yes, it's an acquired taste but this sandwich did not impress me. Upon first bite, it was pretty good. Very interesting and I was happy to have had tried it. But halfway through the sandwich, I felt like I was kind of over it. It got tiring quick afterwards. The Hot Honey sandwich on the other hand -- phew boy this one is a show stopper. My first bite was bursting with flavors. The chicken, the pickles, the sauce, the pretzel bread. Amazing. I would definitely go back when I'm craving a chicken sandwich.

The hot honey chicken sandwich is the BEST! I had a taste of both the salted duck egg and hot honey, and I definitely preferred the Hot Honey sandwich- the Thai basil sauce with them crispy chicken tastes sooo good! The salted duck egg was good but the chicken wasn't as crispy and the taste was not as flavorful.

A really chill environment with friendly service. Had the #10 cider which really helped with the cold weather and the delicious Hot Honey chicken sandwich. With selections that are both affordable and unique, 10/10 would come again.
No comment
No comment

Love the overall vibe as soon as I walked in. There's 2 areas, the front where is more casual and they have drinks on tap and the back where it's a bit more formal and sit down. I was able to try #5 and wow!! If you're like me and you like bitter teas, this is your drink! It was the perfect balance between oolong tea and whiskey. We also got to try the Le Big Mac!  it tasted like a mixture of Mochi and macaroon. Highly recommend!! Will definitely be back to try the formal dining in the back section.

This place is so great! They have a limited menu, but everything on it is perfect. The service is fantastic and they went above and beyond to have us seated at a sanitized table with heaters. You have to get the Le Big Mac to finish, it's as tasty as it is cute. Will definitely be back and also for takeout. Highly recommend!

I'm absolutely in love with Double Chicken Please! They specialize in my favorite things: cocktails and fried chicken. I went with a dear friend of mine and we ordered the #1 and #5 cocktails. Both were amazing! So balanced and paired perfectly with the chips and fried chicken. Now, I've had my fair share of fried chicken sandwiches, but the hot honey ones at DCP... WOW. In my friend's words "you know within that first bite that you're not going to want the experience to end." We ended up ordering another one to share as our "dessert." The spice wasn't overwhelming, but there was still a kick and the Thai basil aioli was light and tempered the heat a bit. I can't wait to return to sit at the bar and try some of the newer menu items!
No comment

Don't judge a book by its cover, or in this case the exterior of the restaurant. It was quite hard booking a reservation for the times that we wanted, but in this case, we booked a week in advance for a Friday evening. Once inside, the lighting was dim, but warm. The inside area of the bar was very high end in my books. I don't go to bars often, but this one definitely took the cake with seating and spacing. First came a pitcher of water and cups for everyone in the party. The weird thing I found with this restaurant was that there was no menu that came to us. My party all ordered on phones. I had to look on with my buddies to see the menu. I should have asked for one, but for some reason I didn't. I guess it was assumed you knew what was on the menu since a menu never came to us. Feels unfair to dock points for that, but I'm used to physical menus. That's just the way I like it. However, the staff made it a very comfortable and an encouraging environment. The staff explained not only what the schedule for the night was (the food that we wanted only gets served after 22:00/10pm, but also provided great insight for drinks and food based on our preferences. I came out more knowledgeable about certain drinks and foods than I did coming in. I ordered a french toast cocktail as I was told it was more of a dessert drink. It was sweet, flavorful, but it reminded you that it was still an alcoholic beverage. That little serving lasted me my whole night. We ordered a small appetizer which was essentially chicken liver pate mixed with coffee butter. Very creamy and rich in taste. The first few bites were great, but it really does get to you after a while. Thankfully there were 4 of us sharing that. We didn't finish the pate unfortunately, ran out of baguette. When the time came, the staff announced they will be taking orders for the sandwiches. Here was what I was waiting for. I honestly wanted to order 2 sandwiches that caught my eye. The hot honey chicken sandwich and the salted duck egg sandwich. I only ordered one because the waiter warned me about how big one sandwich was (thankfully I listened to him). I did try a bite of the salted duck egg and I will definitely order that next time. I ordered the hot honey chicken sandwich which was phenomenal. It had eastern spices / herbs infused and was quite frankly really big. Came out fresh out of the kitchen piping hot. Great perimeter, but the inside was a bit too moist for my liking. Still a solid overall sandwich that gets my seal of approval. I liked it. For the price point, it is on the more luxurious side. I get that you are paying for the experience sometimes, but it is a bit much for my preferences. Would I come back a second time? Absolutely, the food has its reputation. The price does too but, it's not too far unreasonable. Overall, great place with late night vibes. Definitely go with some friends and share a good time together. Bathroom also pretty clean!

We came for a few drinks and were seated in the back room. Very nice and almost futuristic decor and the service was great. The cocktails were fantastic and so innovative. We got the French toast and beet drinks and both were great. Expect to pay a lot of money though, these cocktails were expensive even for NYC prices.
The hen of wood sandwich was amazing. Staff was friendly and courteous. Def make a resy to get a table!
No comment

The best Taiwanese chicken sandwiches! The chicken is so tender and the toppings are super flavorful. The hot honey is my favorite but they're all good. Cocktails are on tap. The #2 is my favorite cocktail, as a tequila drinker. Looking forward to trying the rest of the menu. Come here for a fun and affordable night of dinner/drinks.

I love Double Chicken Please, I'm not normally in the neighborhood but this place is worth the trip. The owner and the man behind their signature drinks is awesome, friendly and knowledgeable. The signature drinks are so unique and delicious. I love the vibe of this place, more casual in the front and more lounge in the back.

I really like their sandwiches and interior design. The drinks are excellent. Great place to catch up with friends, though it can get a little loud.
Is sososo good for the burgers!will be back when dining is open. The combination of salted egg yolk and burger is a new attempt! But it tastes really good! Can't wait to go back for the second time

LOVE this place! First came here when they first opened up thanks to a rec from the awesome people at Attaboy (we had some time to kill before our res there).  What a gem! When we came, they were only serving their awesome taptails.  My friends and I have gone through and tasted all of them and they are all so good! We came back a few weeks ago for a quick taptail and discovered they're now service fancy shmancy cocktails and food in the sexy back area.  Will have to come back to eat all the delicious food and try all the back room cocktails next

The best chicken sandwich in New York City! It was the most amazing sandwich, so flavorful and delicious. The cocktails are also amazing and fresh. Our server was so sweet and the vibe was very chill. Can't say enough good things about this place. Everyone go!
The discrimination of disabled people is unacceptable.
Innovative and quality cocktails. Do not go without getting food as well. Amazing fried chicken sandwhich. The tofu was really good as well.
Great place for food and drinks. Grab a reservation and try the back room. Awesome bartenders and service
The hot honey sandwich was AMAZING and I also got the #1 and #4 drinks which were also really good!! Loved the interior and bar area. 10/10 would recommend!

Beautiful decor and that's about it. Hot honey chicken sandwich and salted duck sandwich was a huge disappointment. Looks delicious but tastes nothing like it looks.. the hot honey chicken sandwich was so greasy and the salted duck sandwich smelled and tasted so fishy. I mean reallyyy fishy that you don't even want to eat it no more when you bring it up to your mouth.  Both are fried which I understand can be a bit greasy but these were extremely greasy. I taste more of the grease than chicken. So in my opinion, not worth the travel here nor the price tags of these sandwiches.
This place is great! The food was 4/5 the drinks 6/5 the service 5/5. I definitely recommend coming here for a late night drink and some good food afterwards! Will be back!

The creativity of the menu is fun! Highlights included the shitake mushroom poppers, oysters, stuffed chicken wings, and chicken liver mousse. Mehs were the beet salad, fried artichokes, prawn head tempura, prawn ceviche
Hospitable attentive and a real low key smooth vibe inside. Food was great. Trying new flavors in the salad open my palette.
No comment
Super good fried chicken sandwiches, unique cocktails and a gracious staff. Definitely will come back

Double Chicken Please rocks our meals anytime - best chicken sandwiches (salted egg yolk + hot honey), house made sweet potato chips, and no 9 cocktail (elderflower is always a favorite flavor).  Can't wait to taste the chicken liver mouse next!!!
No comment
My husband and I walked past here few days ago saw people eating the chicken sandwich and before we left town we had to swing by and try it. Absolutely delicious!!!!! Will def be back

One of the best places in LES for fried chicken sandwiches. It's a Taiwanese style chicken sandwich that always hits the spot. Highly recommend that with their #5 cocktail. They have such delicious cocktails. The #5 is their Kavalan whiskey with patron orange, oolong, longan, and honey. It's not too sweet and very refreshing. Won't be disappointed!!

Oh geez. The hot honey chicken sandwich is a delicious hot mess with hints of Taiwanese flavors. I think it also made a bigger impression than the salted duck egg yolk, but I'm coming back for a few rounds at this spot.   Cocktails on tap are a strong and refreshing balance to the meal, very necessary in my opinion.

Visited Double Chicken Please last night and it was amazing. I had the #6 draft cocktail, the salad (really good!!), and the hot honey chicken.  Everything I had was excellent and the interior is really beautiful designed. The space is large so they were able to spread out all the tables in addition to dividers to accomodate people safely. Everyone there was also extremely welcoming and attentive. They mentioned this was a limited menu for the time being and their full menu sounds really interesting and I will definitely be back to try more.

Best fried chicken sandwiches I've had in NYC. The number two with honey is the perfect combination of sweet, savory, crunchy, and juicy. The cocktails are also bomb - we tried #1, #5, and #6 and are excited to try the others ("#5 is the best" - my gf)

This place is AMAZING. Not only was the food to die for but the owners and server were beyond nice. Awesome cocktails on tap that are very unique and yummmy. This spot is new, would like to see them do well, go support! You won't regret it :)

column3: Long Island City, New York, NY
column6: I am impressed, Double Chicken Please is truly pretty darn cool. Awesome menu. Each and every single menu item that we have purchased was incredibly fresh and tasty. Workers are really lovely and service is very swift. Double Chicken Please: Go here, go here now.
Amazing cocktails and great food. Love the original chicken sandwich! Definitely would recommend getting a couple different sandwiches and sharing!

Yum! If you're a fan of salted duck yolk as I am (I'm calling it as the next big food trend!), this is the chicken sandwich for you. The melange of crispy chicken, salty umami-laden sauce and pillowy brioche is spot on. Their side salad puts high-end restaurants to shame with its complexity and balance of dressing. I can't wait to try the rest of their menu.

loved the speakeasy vibes of this place. not too loud but not too quiet, amazing service and staff, and great food and drinks. their taptails are delicious and the concepts they incorporated throughout the bar is fun! would highly recommend their chicken sandwiches, sour plum chips, and mocktail

Great new spot! Front area feels casual and bright and the back room is very cool and beautifully designed. Drinks on tap were very good, also have non-alcoholic options. Highly recommend the honey chicken sandwich, was awesome! Will be returning, high quality place.

Wow. This is literally one of the best meals I've had in NYC and it came out of nowhere! I'm a huge fan of fried chicken sandwiches and this one in particular was so good that we had to order another one. It has a Thai flavor kick to it with the right hint of Thai basil and of course, the sauce was CRACK lol. The salad was super fresh and all the ingredients blended super well together. Even the goat cheese was super delicious but not overpowering. The ambience was also super nice and they let us know that starting next Saturday, they will extend the cocktail menu and will provide small complimentary garnish pairings with it. Also the cocktail with the fennel and pair is.... highly recommended. Best cocktail I've had in a while!

Wow! Just wow! We were blown away by the chicken sandwiches here and we are picky eaters. 2 of us ordered the hot honey sandwich and one ordered the duck egg chicken sandwich. Outstanding! The best part is the sandwiches are huge so you leave satisfied but not bloated or sick from eating too much. Also ordered the #6 and #10 cocktail. Both super interesting and different. Usually just wine people so not our style but 10/10 for creativity. The staff is also very friendly and inviting. Definitely will be back. You will not be disappointed

Being from LA I might be a chicken sandwich snob  but after reading the review in the Eater I was so excited to try this place! It was a nice day so I figured a long walk and a hot honey chicken sandwich would be icing on the cake. Now I wish I would have taken a picture but i was just so grossed out when my first 2 bites were both fatty, chewy pieces. I lifted the bun and could tell there was another probable spot. I threw it right into the nearest trash can. I want to say I didn't have a cocktail so I can't vouch for those. Perhaps I wouldn't have been so picky about the meat being trimmed had I had one of their "great" cocktails but for me that's a huge quality issue

I eat clean but when I want a chicken sandwich, I want intensely flavorful hot grease spilling onto my trousers. No, I am no stranger to fried food, peppersauce and pickles. This was BY FAR the best chicken sandwich I've eaten more than a couple countries and decades of trying fried chicken sandwiches. Easily the right move. Not too sweet, super crunchy and moist as hell. The drinks menu is tricky but the whiskey ones are decent. Service is speedy, skilled, kind, earnest, and just the type of New York business you want to support wholeheartedly. Safe, clean, loungey environment, with good music and a quick/easy contact trace protocol (QR code) upon entry.

The food has consistently been really good. I usually order delivery. My favs are the oil spill noodle, eggplant salad, shu mai, pan fried noodles, cold noodle. I haven't been here to dine but i've been to their other locations where the service has been fast and polite!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

I loved coming here with my friends and really wish it was more popular. It tastes authenticity Chinese which was pretty shocking to me as the area doesn't have many Chinese restaurants. Their xiao long bao are better than any of the ones you can find in Chinatown. It is clearly hand made and the dumpling skin is superbly made. Although their cumin beef was on the saltier side, once I notified the waiter, they brought it back to the kitchen and added more onions and veggies. It came out much tastier and less salty! Their noodles are greatly portioned and seriously taste like the ones in China. I don't recommend the Chinese burger because there isn't as much filling as I would like but tasty nonetheless! Their desserts were also very good and I loved the rice balls with rice wine! I'll definitely be coming back again and again.
Exceptional Staff, reasonably priced and the dishes were amazing. If you're in the neighborhood DunHuang is definitely worth checking out!

I ordered the lamb hamburger and it was delicious. The bun was crispy, fresh, and well made. The meat was tasty and a bit of spicy that kicked my palates a bit. I am looking forward to an opportunity to come here and complete the all you can eat big bowl challenge. Looking forward to this day to come :)

column3: South Coast Metro, Costa Mesa, CA
column6: staff super nice! food is good too, 红烧牛肉面 is my favorite 凉拌土豆丝 is good too, place is clean and decorated well. I liked it:)
Super friendly and polite service! I got their chicken & a side of bok choy and rice. Definitely need to try the specialty noodles or hot pot to reassess.

I love this Noodle spot ! I bring my lunch to work most days but nice to have choices in the area . The signature Beef Noodle soup is excellent . I think these are pulled hand noodles . Great for a chilly day ! I also like the dumplings . I've had take out for dinner a few time and the dinner portions don't seem to be different than lunch portions . The service is great and the staff friendly .

Service was quick and friendly. I ordered the signature hand pulled noodles with beef and eggplant salad. The Appetizer was delicious and generously portioned. The eggplant salad had plenty of garlic, sesame seeds and scallions submerged into the sauce. It was simply divine. Hand pulled noodles were neatly packed separately from the soup. The texture was bouncy and the soup was so good. I also had the can coconut milk and that came in handy after eating the chili oil with the noodles. The chili oil has a lot of sesame seeds and the spice level is a medium. Love this place.
No comment
No comment
I like the kelp salad and eggplant salad, I can't find them anywhere else, the pork burger is good too.
No comment

This noodle shop is next door to my kickboxing studio, I've been tempted to try the restaurant for months but never made it in because I've been trying to watch my caloric intake. I am so happy that I decided to have a cheat meal here-- the soup was flavorful, rich and well seasoned. This is definitely hands down my second favorite noodle shop in the city.
No comment
Easy, quick, and delicious homemade noodles and soup that just reminds me of my trips to Asia. Been in this area twice in the past few months and both times have gotten takeout from here.
No comment

Excellent. Discovered by accident on a business trip to Brooklyn, this restaurant is now one of my regular spots when I am in town. The decor is light and open, with a clear view into the kitchen where the cooks are proudly stretching noodles. (A visible kitchen always induces confidence.) The serving staff are efficient, but not pushy, and even those with weaker English are ready to help with suggestions.  The then there is the food - tasty with perfectly cooked noodles. Lastly, dinner for two with tip and including drinks, is a very affordable $60. Altogether, this restaurant is a reliable and fulfilling experience.

I just ordered from this place for the first time. I ordered popcorn chicken and the picture shows what I got. $16, no rice, and a package full of fried chili peppers with almost no chicken. There was probably around seven small pieces of overly fried chicken chunks. This place is a complete ripoff.
No comment

So happy I found this place. I use to go to Chinatown every time I needed some hand pulled noodles but now have this place right around the corner!  Their broth is delicious, their noodles the perfect texture. I was surprised by the cold potato salad. So good!  The tea that comes with the lunch specials is sweet and delicious. Comes hot though so might ask for ice next time!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Awesome flavors and super fresh. Had eggplant salad, sauteed bok choy, soup dumplings. All very excellent and a good combination. Very friendly staff as well.
No comment
No comment
I ordered spicy popcorn chicken. It had 6 tiny chicken pieces and the rest of the plate was chopped red peppers. Completely inedible. why don't we have good Chinese in this part of town?
No comment
No comment
Great food.  Great staff. Great way to start off Lunar New Year.  Highly recommended
No comment
辣子鸡感觉不想是新做的，盐没撒匀，鸡肉骨头没剃干净，非常的硬。而且是温的...就很离谱。就真的感觉这家店逐渐敷衍，然后这次一场敷衍！非常敷衍！菜是敷衍了，价格却没降. 吃到一半只能去吃方便面。这还不如方便面！就真的很不好吃！
Delicious noodles, great price. Unlike any other noodle place around. Place was clean and well kept and the ingredients fresh. Loved it, will be back
my go-to spot for authentic Chinese food in Brooklyn! Love their eggplants, it's super savory and appetizing. Highly recommend their ribs and and beef too.
Delivery was faster than estimated, the noodles were delivious, the broth rich and buttery, meat fell apart. Hit the spot.
Simply my favorite Chinese Noodle spot.  They are the best!!!
Nice spot for Pratt students to get some genuine Chinese noodle. Recommended or all that's interested in Spicy, Chinese noodle, cuisine etc.
This place looked good on Uber eats and was horrible. We ordered dry noodles, short ribs and cucumbers and all of them were inedible. How is this place so highly rated? Buyer beware...
Very nice Restaurant, food is amazing, service is great and nice environment, highly recommended

This is my second time to come to the shop, very enthusiastic service, special recommend is their home dishes really authentic, I like them very much, big chicken and conger lamb, also must try their hemp fiber cucumber , delicious to heaven!
Ordered delivery for two orders and they just sent me one order. They did not pick up after I called about 10 times. Very frustrated! Horrible service.
This Outpost nestled on the edge of the Navy Yard has a nice noodles and some nice staff. Give it a shot!
The place was super clean and it has amazing service. The food was delicious, I highly recommend this hidden gem in Brooklyn!!
incredible hand pulled noodles! the broth is so clean and warms the soul. their sides are also great - try the mung bean noodles, the shredded chicken and eggplant. 10/10

Everything I've tried on this menu is amazing. Unless you're willing to go to flushing you're gonna be hard pressed to find authentic Chinese noodles that are this good. Staff is really friendly and the noodles are all awesome. The spice level is also really decent!

I ordered the Lamb chop. They specifically advertised it outside with photos; "crispy on the outside, juicy on the inside, with sesame seeds". It arrived kind of soggy, with the meat inside hard and stringy, and no sesame seeds. It looked like it had been deep fried.  It was nasty. DIfficult to chew and after 2 bites, I threw it away. And for that, I Paid $21.  A total waste, really a culinary crime.
Food too good to take photo before devouring it.... best noodle and BEST lamb dishes you can find
No comment
No comment

This place is the real deal. A noodle joint with serious style and opinion! Someone on here was complaining that most of the dishes are doused in garlic and chili oil. Well, I think noodles dripping with garlic and chili are one of the greatest things you can possibly eat, and if you want general tso's you can go to the fifty other places serving that. I've tried almost all of the noodle dishes here and every one is delicious. Particular favorites are the spicy oil spill noodles and dunhuang cold noodles, both packing a fantastic punch, though the beef noodle soups are great if you prefer something less spicy. All of the cold sides are very good but I highly recommend the eggplant, melting and smothered with sweet fried garlic and tangy soy dressing.

4 stars only because I feel an ethnic restaurant should play their cultural music to complete the ambience. Western pop is so unappetizing anyway. That niggle aside, Miss Noodle is a keeper! Very warm and accommodating service staff and food quality that definitely warrants repeat visits to try everything on the menu! Please play some cool Asian music guys! Thanks for all your efforts so far. The neighborhood is going to love you!
Tasty, prompt and professional delivery, and just spicy enough to, maybe, drive away the evil flu spirits.
No comment
Visited today and really like this location. It is spacious and service is great. My favorite are the noodles of course!

The food is delicious. The girl on the phone though doesn't understand/communicate English well though, makes it difficult to ask questions or even order over the phone if I wanted to. Based on the reviews and menu I just walked there, out of frustration. Everything was on point, I got the spare ribs, eggplant salad and the Lanzhou soup. All tasty. This place has the potential to become a favorite of mine.

Ordered fried noodles, spare ribs and cucumber, with decent expectations. Unfortunately the food from this establishment is barely edible. The chicken in the noodles and the pork spare ribs were clearly old. This place attempted to cover up their low quality ingredients with sugar. Disgusting. It's too bad because we need another legit Chinese place in northern Brooklyn.
Shop decoration is awesome! The foods taste as good as the other stores in NYC. Great location inn Brooklyn, as you can easily find parking right in front of the store.
Delicious.  Best soup dumplings I've had in NYC.   Noodles are gorgeous.  So happy to have Miss Noodles in the neighborhood.
This is the best noodle house in the neighborhood，I really love it. Great food and great service

Finally, a proper Chinese restaurant in Clinton Hill. I've lived in Clinton Hill for 10 years and the one thing that has been missing in this perfect little Brooklyn neighborhood is a good, sit-down, authentic Chinese restaurant. The food is all delicious. We ate here during a soft opening so hopefully all the yummy food we had stays on the menu. The staff is attentive and kind, and they genuinely want to provide the best possible experience.

Ordered a takeout dish - chicken fried noodle for lunch.  Food was lukewarm.  There were only three small pieces of chicken, 5-6 small pieces of vegetables (cabbages/carrots).  The rest was tasteless noodles.  Totally not worth the $12.99+tax I paid.  Will not go back there for sure
Will be back soon!! Def try the thick cut noodles! Noodles are made in house so Fresh!! Waiters were so sweet too!
great noods with pork ragut. tasty, not heavy, satisfying. will be back. will be back. will be back
No comment
This place is great. The food is delicious, the prices are super reasonable and the service is very friendly. The eggplant salad is insane and all the noodle dishes are amazing. So glad it opened!
Finally got a chance to try the food. Newly opened place.  Great beed braised noodles soup.   Reasonable price's.  Eggplant with Garlic etc side dish went great as an appetizer.  Enjoyed.

So glad I got to check out this new spot!!! Ordered the kelp salad, vegetarian  panfried noodles, sauteed bok choy & the  eight treasure rice pudding -- all of it was very authentic, delicious, freshly made & good prices in an elegant space. Service was very nice & super-attentive. Great addition to the neighborhood --  looking fwd to coming back :)

Flushing comes to Clinton Hill! Awesome food, atmosphere and service. The eggplant salad is addictive, the simple name undersells the huge flavors. Good vegetarian options. They said the menu will expand once they have their grand opening in February but I wouldn't have guessed they're still ramping up. Great addition to the neighborhood.
Really authentic Lanzhou food. Adorable and delicious. The chicken salad and mutton on the bone are must-have. Nice service as well.
Great delivery but a lot of garlic and oily Chile sauce on everything. It could be worse. Happy to find so,e comfort food. The kale salad was spot on and easy for leftover meals. .
Great and authentic taste. Especially the braised lamb shoulder noodle, also the oil noodle
Easy pickup and the food was simply amazing. The food was spicy, but not to the point where it was too much and even my parents who don't eat spicy foods loved it.
Good taste and service!!! I really like the sweet ribs and noddles. Hope the restaurant can be better in the future.
great food best noodle house in town， we been waiting for almost two years, they have a lot of great  dishes not only noodles
This place is so good!! Delicious, super authentic Chinese food. Largely Sichuan-y. Tasty AF.
amazing food, amazing service, elegant decor that's great for a date night! i will definitely be coming again and again
No comment
No comment
No comment
Food is amazing and service is great.  Ask for Alivia.  If you're older, like me, get there early, fills up fast.
Dakos was incredibly tasty if you like oily salads, and meat platter was good because I was staring at chihuahua and he was staring me, I liked water though. Pure life.

Kiki's is a real treat. Everything here is fresh and delicious. My personal favorite dishes are their horiatiki salad, lamb chops, tzatziki, & French fries. It's a really fun vibe, and a great place to come with a group of friends to share a couple of dishes.

The place is so nicely done. We went on the weekend for lunch and did not have to wait, although we did not have a reservation. Service was quick. We got the spanakopita and it was great. Apart from that rest of the food we had was just okay. Briam was sautéed vegetables and it was pretty bland and even their fava dip. But sure if it's a good spot for vegetarians.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Some of the best greek food I've ever had! Everything tasted so fresh and perfectly seasoned. Also loved the ambiance and cozy decor. Will definitely come back here!
Overall very good. However, the chicken entree was not edible and had that bad chicken smell/taste. My favorite dish was the lamb chops and zucchini chips.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Satisfactory Greek food whose dishes are nothing to write home about, however has one of the strongest dating atmospheres in the city. The octopus was easily their best dish. $18 a dish. 3.75/5 stars as dinner spot.

Like many other restaurants in the area, the restaurant has old vintage signs. All windows were open so it was a bit chilly. Staff were nice and it didn't take long to get a table for 3 on a Saturday afternoon. I got salad and lemon roasted chicken with potatoes. The chicken was very hearty. Food was good. There's a 3% fee to pay with card.
No comment

Solid greek restaurant in lower Manhattan. I was a bit disappointed that they ran out of grilled octopus and the chicken souvlaki skewers which can apparently only be ordered at their sister restaurant (the main reason why I wanted to come here). I ended up getting the lamp chops, saganaki, dakos salad, and the shrimp. Everything was super flavorful. Also loved the restaurant vibe - it was quirky and quaint without coming across pompous.

Really cool spot! The eggplant dip was amazing. The lamb was delicious but there were a ton of fries and the rest of the meat on the platter wasn't quite as good. All in all, cool place for a date or friends night out!

Went out for dinner w a group of 8 friends and this spot was perfect for it. It's got a fun, lively atmosphere and the food is great for sharing. The souvlaki, moussaka, feta fries, shrimp, and dips were all delicious. It's very reasonable for the area too.

The outside is a regular signs storefront and doesn't have the name kikis outside but it's on a corner. There's lot of tables inside and it's a pretty big place but it does get packed. I went for dinner and got the tzatziki, octopus, lamb chops, moussaka, and finished off with their cheesecake. Everything was soo good. Tzatziki with the pita bread was good and flavorful. Octopus was tender. Lamb chops were amazing and came with fries. Moussaka had eggplant and meat and very very filling. Also goes well with a glass of wine. And definitely get the cheesecake!! The crust was amazing. Will definitely be back for more!
No comment
No comment
Yeah. Fairly good Greek spot in Chinatown. Mostly like barbecue stuff. Get it. Enjoy all the hipster folks.
No comment

Kiki's is the perfect spot for authentic and affordable greek food. You will definitely have to wait for a table but it's really worth it! Come with a group for a fun boozy dinner and shared food. Their house wine carafes Fries are to die for but everything else was amazing too including this mixed grill plate, lemon chicken, vegetables and spinach rice.
No comment
No comment
No comment

column3: University of Texas at Austin, Austin, TX
column6: Kiki's is one of my absolute favorites here! The food is delicious, the servers are very prompt and they want to make sure everything's right. Typically this place is very busy and can get up to a 3 hour wait time so plan ahead cause they don't take reservations!

Definitely a must try when your in the canal area staff was friendly food was delicious love there octopus love the brazino fish n i had the must have famous strawberry cheesecake definitely looking forward to visit soon
No comment
No comment

Kiki's is a special spot in the city. Love this gem and the food. I didn't get any pictures of the food because we absolutely devoured it but it is sooo tasty. It can be hard to get in but it seems to be a favorite of large groups. They have both sides of the street and the restaurant is unmarked other than the copious amounts of people spilling out onto the sidewalk and their doors being wide open for a glimpse inside. The tzatziki is to die for and the pita is so soft. I had the chicken with potatoes and the sauce really made the meal. The chicken also wasn't too dry. Inside there is a lot of energy and rustic decor.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Great service, we sat at the bar, food was meeeeh. Not trash but not mind blowing to me. The tzatziki and house wine were pretty good, but the rest of our meal, roasted chicken with lemon potatoes and lamb, underwhelmed. It wasn't nasty, but not fire. Cool New York vibe type of place but not overall not for me.

If you're expecting food here that will blow you out of the water, this is not the place. The hype of this place on social media might make you think otherwise; however, that being said, the food is GREAT and SO cheap! The atmosphere and service are also great. This is a perfect spot for a quick, good, consistent, and authentic meal.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Incredible place. Ambiance is amazing, food was stellar, and service was great. Had heard great things but the experience surpassed it.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Location, fast service and great food. Everything I look for in a restaurant. Will go back.
No comment
No comment

After visiting Greece, I swore to make it my mission to find Greek food in the city. Astoria has some of the best I find but this place hands down is a vibe. It's the environment, the energy, the people and of course the star of everything - the food. I always order the octopus. It has changed over the years but I still like the char finish. Spanakopita apps, lamb chop (must order medium closer to rare) and the fries are bomb! Only downside is no reservations due to how popular it is and the long wait when it's busy times.

Lovely ambiance and quality mediterranean food at a reasonable price! Called before arrival and employee was able to answer all my questions. Ordered 4 items and shared them all with a friend. The tzatziki was rich, perfectly seasoned and came with a bowl of bread. When we ran out, our server kindly brought out a second serving. We also ordered the sautéed shrimp in a cream that was delicious and garlicky in addition to the zucchini chips and greek salad. I was impressed by the service and freshness of the ingredients. It is BYOB but cork service is $25 which is more than I was willing to pay.
No comment
No comment
Exceedingly long wait, they told us a time and took 40 minutes extra. Overly salty food with a lack of sauce. Only upside was the price but not worth the wait and subpar food.

column3: Lower East Side, New York, NY
column6: No comment

YUM! I love Kiki's. Definitely one of my staples in the city. I've been a few times and you really can't go wrong with anything on the menu. I think my favorite dish is the Spanakopita. And you absolutely can't forget finishing off your meal with some cheesecake. Cannot recommend enough!

I knew Kiki's was going to be good but not GOOD! Wow, was I surprised? Absolutely!  Every dish was a knockout. I ordered Zucchini Chips, Maroulosalata, Fava, Sautéed Shrimp, and Bread & Pita. My favorite dish was the Maroulosalata, which was a Mediterranean salad. The vegetables and feta tasted incredibly fresh. The fava, which was similar to hummus in its consistency, was delicious and creamy. The zucchini chips were fried and crisped to perfection, making it a perfect side dish that was difficult to stop eating. The shelled Sautéed Shrimp was well seasoned in a tasty creamy sauce. My only negative critique was that staff did not ask to see my proof of vaccination, which I volunteered and showed staff. The restaurant had ample indoor and outdoor dining. It's a very clean restaurant and is located in a hip neighborhood.
No comment

Our server Bennett was exceptionally kind and also very sexy. He seated us quickly and took our order with a charming smile. We ordered sautéed shrimp, grilled octopus, fava beans, lamp chops (come with fries), and spaghetti (mixed creme and tomato sauce). The cold fava bean smear was creamy and reminiscent of a chick pea texture, served with tomatoes, onions and capers. Lamb chops were juicy, succulent & tender. The fries and sauce were perfectly oily and flavorful. We loved the octopus. The sautéed shrimp were in an exquisite creme sauce. Seating outside felt European and perfect on a cool early summer night. The cheese cake was airy and not too heavy. Three of us shared it and it was delicious.
No comment
Delicious. Food was light and perfect for afternoon lunch. Was crowded inside but sitting weather was nice enough to enjoy outside seating.
Doesn't live up to the reviews. Service is decent but food is very average. Having said that, it's a cute quaint place but well if the food isn't good, am not going back!

Do not expect them to help you , these people have bad attitudes towards you, no service will be provided. This woman specifically rude, no helps at all , and she rolls her eyes at us. She plays on her phone all the time , it's like they paid her to play with her phone on the restaurant.We didn't feel treated right , 2 plates for 52 dollars also very expensive.
No comment
No comment
No comment

I have been coming here for years. Fun trendy vibe. It gets packed so I usually come early or late ( they are open for food until midnight-many places post pandemic close by 10pm) . food comes out fast and the food is well priced ! It's almost like Greek tapas- its nice to order a bunch of things and share with friends. Octopus , shrimp , bifteki and all dips are my favorite.  The cheese with honey is good but heavy. Lamb is hit or miss here I would probably avoid ordering it as I've had really good and bad experiences. They used to have more beers and wine from Greece- selection is a bit less. Would like to see them bring that back - like the red donkey. Who wants to go to a Greek place and order a goose island IPA????
No comment

Solid spot. Food is delicious but the portions are small and prices are high for what your getting. I don't mind spending money on great food but I think you're paying for the hype this spot has. Overall I would still come back.
No comment

Wow! This place was amazing- it reminded me of being in Greece! The food is authentic and everything is so good! It's a little hole in the wall with such character but so worth the visit. I do suggest getting here as soon as they open because they don't take the reservations and the wait can fill up quickly. To start we ordered the tzatziki, , taramosalata and Greek Salad. All the dips came with pita and bread and everything was so delicious! The eggplant dip was probably my favorite thing I had here it is so good I definitely recommend ordering! To continue, we had spanakopita, grilled octopus and bifteki, everything was delicious. The spanakopita was beautifully crispy and filled with amazing flavors, grilled octopus was prepared perfectly and the bifteki was AMAZING, cooked to perfection and filled with flavor! When here I definitely recommend not missing out on the bifteki, spanakopita and the melitzanosalata (eggplant). This place is a staple of LES do not miss out on coming here!
No comment
No comment

Below average Greek food but you can eat in a faux-neighborhood called Dimes Square. I don't think there was a single New Yorker in the area. It's an interesting area populated by young hipsters that have no regard for their parents' cash
No comment

The service was great, and the food came out quickly. The portions were perfect and the dish was very reasonably priced. A salad at Sweet Green costs the same amount as the dish I ordered--and you're definitely getting a lot more food here.
No comment
Good food, reasonably priced, not pretentious, relaxed atmosphere. 5 stars easily.
Good avgolemeno! Looking forward to trying more dishes. Very cool atmosphere with lots of younger folks!
No comment
Best moussaka I've ever had. Hands down. GET IT. Also the fried cheese appetizer. Those two things blew everything away.
No comment
No comment

We were inbetween happy hour and a BYOB comedy show, so not 100% hungry nor thirsty. After checking to be sure we could leave with unfinished wine, we ordered a bottle of Oenodea and each had a glass. We also ordered the grilled octopus, palates me avga, and the moussaka (as they were out of the lamb frikasse.) the octopus was super tasty and tender, the fries opted with oregano, feta cheese and an egg, and the moussaka was huge. Since we'd already devoured some happy hour treats, we actually took a doggie bag home, and the rest of the wine went on to our next stop. Luckily we were seated near a fan. My taste buds were happy but my only complaint was that there was no air conditioning.

Vibes of this place were really cool!!! Their lemon potatoes were quite frankly the best potato I've ever had in my life. Was a little expensive but was worth it for the experience and the food. Highly recommend the chicken and lemon potatoes.

column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: This restaurant is a classic for a reason and the food and ambiance are great. Perfect spot for a group of friends to go to share and all leave happy and full!
No comment

Despite great reviews from my friends, my experience at Kiki's was overall not great. We got there on a super cold night and the line was out the door. We opted for outdoor seating, but none of the tables had heat lamps or covers so we had to brave the winds. The waiters weren't super attentive and the food was cold as soon as it got to our table. The only thing going for them was their wine deal (you can get a liter of wine for a very low price). Hopefully I can come back and have a better experience here.
No comment
No comment
Great Orange wine and Baklawa!! Would go back amy time, great service and cozy ambiance.
The food quality went down. I ordered lamb chops and octopus- poor preparation and flavor. Seems like while rushing to make more money by expending they sacrificed quality.
The food was AMAZING, but the host was rude and on some sort of unnecessary power trip.  Bad day, maybe, but I'll avoid the place if they're working again.

Great atmosphere for a cozy, cool, dark vibe. Bartender was so nice and helped me and my hubs get a table at the bar which is full menu. Line was long but if you linger by bar you should get a spot quickly. Love this place!
No comment

We had to wait about 40th minutes for a table for 4, but it was expected (Thursday night and all). But it was totally worth the wait! We ended up getting a ton of small plates for the table and everything was absolutely delicious. Only reason not giving this a 5 star is because we got put at a table in the corner and the staff seemed to forget about us at some point, had to remind them about our orders but I'm assuming it was simply because of how busy they were. Otherwise it was splendid for dinner
No comment
No comment

Affordable, friendly, fast & hearty! Kiki's has my heart. Great homestyle authentic Greek food. Great for large groups as well due to the prices and theres something on the menu for everyone. Do get the house wine its a great deal! The lemon potatoes, and spanakopita are also a must! Then from there pick which meat you desire. Can't go wrong with the lamb frikasse, tender and so juicy. Falls right off the bone and melts in your mouth. Paired nicely with the imam baildi vegetable medley especially on a brisk spring night. Everything was hot, came out fast and with a smile (behind the mask lol). Reallly good stuff! So many people agree that they expanded to another location right across the street!

I was in the LES neighborhood and my friend and I stopped here for brunch. We ended up inside (which had limited capacity and many open windows and was fine COVID-wise). The food was excellent! I just loved the Greek egg toast - especially the salad they chopped up. I wish I could make that myself. The zucchini chips were also delish. Wait staff were good but it's the food I'll come back for. Thanks, chef!

This place is quite hidden, so I was lucky to hear about it from a friend. I shared 1L of house red and the sampler meat platter for three with two other friends, and we were absolutely stuffed by the end of our meal. Our waitress was incredibly welcoming and helpful. If you're looking for a cozy Mediterranean atmosphere -- and a lot of meat -- try out this place!

Overall I loved the food here. Service was OK, not amazing but friendly enough. Definitely try some of the natural wines on offer. My favorite dishes were the spinach pie (spanokopita) and the zucchini chips by far!
No comment

Food here was all delicious. I had the chicken which really hit the spot but my friends got more traditional mediteranean dishes and everything was great. Beer menu is a little limited but overall great spot.
No comment
Came here with a large group. We were able to get a seat outside. Unexpectedly pretty good gem. Would highly recommend.
One of my favorite Greek restaurants. Sooo yummy and the prices are great. You have to get the saganaki.

I am Greek so I know the real deal. This place serves food that tastes like Yia Yia's and it is reasonably priced. The Greek lager was a real treat too. This is the perfect place to share small and large plates.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

so delicious and a must stop every time we're in the area! Everything is so so fresh and I especially recommend getting the house white wine with anything you get. It'll certainly complement. Ask well the pastizou is DIVINE and if you've never had it before, you should certainly try it here first because they do it best!
Delicious food but kind of pricey given the portion sizes. I ordered the eggplant dish and my friends got the chicken skewers.
Love Kiki's it's always lively and delicious.  They have something for everyone and a great wine selection as well.  Authentic food that is reasonably priced and always a good time!
No comment
No comment
No comment

Wow -- they were SO awful here. It's upsetting cause I've loved it for a long time but lately the host, Glen, has been spreading toxic energy around. He got physically and verbally aggressive with another customer last time I went. Never going back.
No comment
Super tasty and affordable authentic Greek food with trendy vibes on a fun block in Les/Chinatown. I love the Spanakopita, the Avgo-Lemono soup, and the wines are really good.
No comment
Everything here is really good. Pasta, the meat plate, the salads, the apps. The only downside could be the wait on busy times as they don't take reservations.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Finallyyy checked out Kiki's and we loved it. The only downside is the waiting process (took us about an hour to receive the call) but other than that, everything was perfect - service, food, price, etc.
Amazing greek food! The zucchini chips are amazing and it is very cheap! Great service. We went at 7pm on Friday for 4 people and we did not have to wait.

All the food we were served was luke warm at best.  Given the tepidity of the food, nothing could be beyond bland. The lamb chop were dry, even though we asked for medium rare. The octopus was cold. The moussaka I think could have been good had it not come room temperature. Everything was just underwhelming.

The service is extraordinary. And the space is really beautiful, and warm and nice at any time of the day. The menu has a clear concept: Greek classics modernized, but not in a sophisticated way, just making them a bit lighter. The octopus is great, and nothing is below the category of "delicious". Only thing, is that it could go further in creativity.
No comment

This is the best Greek food we have had in NYC! Kiki's is a cozy restaurant with 3 bars now! 2 in the one restaurant, 1 across the street. From outside, there is no sign that says "Kiki's." We got a liter of house wine for $26 and had incredible food. For appetizers, we got the tzatziki which was perfect & came with pita and cucumbers (which we requested). We also got the Greek salad (horiatiki) which was fresh & delicious. We also enjoyed the octopus. The patates me agave were delicious and the eggs were perfectly cooked (not too runny). The honey mustard sauce with the fries was fabulous. For dinner, we have ordered the moussaka (eggplant, potatoes, & meat) & the lamb (amazing). There are not gluten free denotations on the menu but the waitress was helpful with navigating the menu. The waitress said that they use the same grill with bread so this restaurant is definitely not for those that are very sensitive to gluten.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

The food was pretty bland and unseasoned. The grilled octopus was good in that it was tender, but we couldn't taste any other seasoning, only the lemon juice from what we squeezed. The portion of the octopus was also smaller than what was seen in the pictures, so I guess that's inflation for ya. We also ordered the pastichio plate and branzino. I didn't expect the pastichio to be sweet, and it tasted more like it was an apple pie, considering the cinnamon and brown sugar taste. The branzino was the highlight of the meal, but was still on the bland side. This dish came with a side of potatoes or rice, and we opted for the rice. This rice seemed to only rely on the sauce for flavoring, because it straight up tasted like tomato sauce. Additionally the service was flat out bad. The server never came up to us to ask how the food was, never asked if we needed anything else, and never came to refill our water. We were able to wave him down at the end, and even then he only asked if we were done and if he could take the plates away. This place is not worth the hype.
Great spot perfect for a date or meeting friends. Everything on the menu is really good. Below is a combination of photos of different foods we've had.

Found this place a bit overrated. Restaurant is hot and cramped. Food sizes are *relatively* cheap (not cheap overlap) and small. Flavors were OK. Will keep looking for reasonably priced greek food before coming back.

Kiki's is an amazing place to eat authentic greek food. I came here for lunch. The ambiance was chill. The service was decent. The food was delicious and high quality. I recommend the horiataki salad, the melitzanosalata, fava bean, and tzatziki dips, the roasted lemon potatoes, and the baklava.
No comment

Kiki's is a long time favorite of mine and I typically recommend it to friends. I was thoroughly disappointed, however, that I found a hair in my lamb chops. The manager offered me a dessert to make up for it which I personally did not eat and when I asked that my meal be taken off the check the response was " well everyone has hair " and " you found it at the end of the meal. " Meanwhile I had the hair in my hand when I told them, it didn't match the color or texture of anyone sitting at my table, and stopped eating once I found it. I've never had a restaurant push back on a sanitary issue with a meal and was frankly taken aback.
Henry !!!! Omg best waiter EVER!!! He was so kind and helpful I love my dinner here WOW

This is a cozy and busy place.  Nobody check's vaccine status, or wear masks and menus are recycled, which was a bit disconcerting.  Food was good, but confusing to order.  Some plates come with sides, but others don't.  I was served a mountain of meat, but nothing else.  My tablemate got a salad and french fries on his plate though.   Maybe you're supposed to order family style?  The wait staff didn't mention anything about that.  Appetizers were good.   I will try it again post pandemic.

KIKI do you love me?! Bc I loved Kiki. A 5 minute walk from my Airbnb we popped in for a late Sunday dinner. The saganaki, greek salad & zucchini chips were all amazing shareable plates! The moussaka was delicious as well but super rich so we couldn't finish. Definitely tasted homemade! Okay also the vibes were super chill and the servers were so sweet. Absolutely felt at home here. Come here for date night, come with your friends!
No comment

I ordered a salad and fries but my salad never came. I sat and sat and reminded the waiter and he said the kitchen forgot. My family were eating their meal and I saw someone who came after me get the salad. Such a disappointing experience. I was excited to try a Greek restaurant in the city and in fact I was the one who chose to try this place. The salad was coming out but I decided to cancel it as everyone at my table was almost finished eating.  Nit only that, the waiter made us wait forever for our check and we needed to ask for a to go box twice. Very poor service.
No comment

I rarely give places 5 stars, but the ambiance, the NYness of it all, at Kiki's is unmatched. I loved the rustic feel of the restaurant, the openness of the seating arrangements, and the kind demeanor of the people that work there. I had the sort of puree(d) feta with red peppers; l know it has a name, but I like to call it spicy feta. I also ordered the lamb fricassee...it was good. warm. comforting. felt like a home-cooked meal. also felt like I was eating on the set of GoT (lol). My friend and I also split a bottle of wine. It was delicious and wasn't costly. I am more of a cocktail girl, but the bottle certainly did the job. will be returning.
No comment

My hubby and I was craving Greek food so we found this little gem. At first when you look at the entrance it doesn't look like it's a restaurant because of the advertisement signs on top. But once you enter, you'll feel like you've been transported into this little cute beach house vibe restaurant. I ordered the Greek salad (delicious!), grilled octopus, and the mixed platter. Everything was shareable portion. Our bellies was full and happy by the time we left :)

Amazing, simply amazing. Favorite in the neighborhood. Whoever was on AUX, good shit.

column3: Huntingdon Valley, Lower Moreland Township, PA
column6: A true gem. Some of the best Greek in nyc in a super cool environment at an extraordinarily reasonable price. The wait can get long so either go early or be prepared to wait during prime time. Everything is excellent you really can't go wrong here.
Cutest little spot. Sit outside and enjoy the zucchini chips. It was a busy Friday night and we didn't have to wait.

A no-attitude hipster restaurant with incredible food. What's not to love? Try everything.  I plan to keep going back.  Yum.

Be warned of the very, very small portion sizes-- that look about half the size as the in person photos.

Cool staff, great food, great atmosphere, no pretension no BS LES restaurant. Decent prices.

What a cute little spot! Honestly, if your passing by it you'd never guess there was a restaurant inside. Once inside, lights are dim and the vibe is great. Food & wine was delicious. Awesome spot!

service is ok but food is overpriced for no reason. the fries tasted like it's reheated and the lamb was very dry for medium temp. the ambiance is different which might be why people check this placd out

Kiki's is the best. Great food, great vibe. Nice service. Got the Greek salad, tzatziki, zucchini chips, lemon chicken and cheesecake. The zucchini chips are to die for, and I would have the chicken once a week if I could. Perfectly moist and tender and flavorful. Sit at the window if you can for great people watching.

Very spacious outdoor seating, the staff wears masks, and the food was really delicious!

Last time we were here the blonde haired waiter forgot one of our orders and my drink, also almost spilled tzatziki on my friend then didnt replace the spilled food!

Kiki's was dope. Went with the fam, got a bunch of stuff to share. Both Very simple but delicious dishes and also incredibly specific and delicious dishes. I recommend the Spanakopita and if you're not that into Greek food, or you got kids, or newbies, Get the Saganaki or the patates me avga. The patates r these perfectly fried French fries with some feta, herbs, and fried egg on top and the saganaki is this fried/baked cheese pastry thing with lemon and honey and I literally ascended off the ground upon bite. So definitely bring like weights or a like a dense item/friend to hold u down and keep u grounded.

To put things in perspective, it doesn't matter what you get at Kiki's - everything is good. The prices are reasonable, portions big and the atmosphere is lively yet intimate with small tables and ideal for a date or catching up with friends. They don't accept reservation so depending on when you go you'll likely have to wait if it's not during an off time. I think it's one of the best Greek restaurants I've been to in Manhattan and I continue to include it as a recommendation for friends.

Absolutely loved it- had lunch here and everything was perfect!! Good music delicious food fun ambience

Love the vibe and food ! It's really good takeout , love the individual chicken skewers and the feta salad : I could eat everyday !

Kikis is my favorite greek food of all time. Every thing on the menu is top notch - my favorites being octopus, lamb chops, and dips. The Greek fries are incredible and probably my favorite fries in the city. Super cheap too. Must visit! But no res so be prepared to wait if you get there after 6.

Hands down one of the best restaurants in New York. The food is absolutely amazing and the prices very reasonable. Always order the octopus and sausage they never disappoint.

Such a cool place. There are no signs of what this place is so just walk in and know your in the right place. I would suggest making reservations this place is packed. It is a big space as well. The food is top notch and so is the service. The really loved the soup. The spinach pie is a huge piece and it was heavy and very filling. I would recommend this place to anyone who is looking for authentic Greek cuisine.

COVID-19 outdoor dining review: during the beginning of the pandemic, a friend and I got takeout from Kiki's (Greek salad, eggplant dip, and a side of fries) and ate everything with delight on a nearby bench. When they opened for outdoor dining this summer, I eagerly came back, and can report that this restaurant still knocks it out of the park. Getting a table both times I came for dinner was shockingly easy, even at prime time, as they have quite a few outdoor tables set up on the street. The setup feels very spacious, and they've been able to maintain the same cool but low-key vibe that made it so easy to while away hours here drinking their house wine and eating simple, excellent food. I've had most of the menu at this point, but faves are definitely the saganaki, moussaka, Greek salad, octopus, shrimp in the mustard-cider vinaigrette, avgolemono soup (pre-pandemic, I loved coming alone during the week and eating the soup + the octopus or shrimp with a book at the bar), roasted lemon potatoes, and my beloved cheesecake.

I eat here ALL THE TIME. Dinner never ever disappoints! The serving sizes are family style & we always have a hefty to-go bag after every meal. Kiki's leftovers the next day?! Yes! Service is great. They were very COVID friendly & all the tables were spaced out appropriately. I tell my friends about this place all the time!

Kiki's is the absolute best. The food is out of this world and the owner is a rockstar. The meat platter is my go too but honestly everything I've had from Kiki's has been wonderful. Also, make sure you save room for dessert, Nicko's cold cheesecake is a must have

Outstanding experience. There's usually a long wait in the weekends but lots of fun bars around that area. The octopus was good the fries with mustard sauce was amazing. The honey and cheese hot appetizer was really good and different. I cannot wait to go back and try 10 other things.

Not sure why everyone says the food is good- it's bland Greek food.. they make up for it with volume over quality. There are so many better places in the city for Greek. This place was better for the atmosphere during normal times but now with Covid that part isn't there either.

The saganaki is soooo amazing!!!!! the Patates Me Avga are such a special dish. Everything is so good    Also love the environment, good outdoor seating and great cozy location
No comment

I love this place, I wish you could make reservations. I came here with my girlfriends and waited an hour, but it was worth it. Everything we ordered was delicious, the vibe is cool. The restaurant isn't that big so it contribute to the long wait. I suggest putting your name down, getting a drink somewhere and coming back. We ordered grilled octopus, it was perfect didn't taste fishy. The Horiatiki salad, also good traditional dish. The waitress suggested the saganaki, I wouldn't have ordered this on my own but it's a must. I can't explain why it's so good but it just is, especially love the honey. My friends shared branzino, and I ordered the moussaka, which was good and super filling.

Talk about a hidden gem! The wait is long but WELL worth it. I recommend the Greek salad and the spanakopita. This is the best Greek restaurant in the city hands down.

We stumbled upon Kikis and had such a fresh delicious meal. What a treat!  Will be back.

column3: Downtown Jersey City, Jersey City, NJ
column6: No comment

Just discovered this place recently, so insanely good. Lemon potatoes and tzatziki are top tier and must-tries. This is definitely a restaurant where you can tell everything is fresh and homemade - from the breads to the vegetables. 10/10 highly recommend this place.

I have been wanting to try this place for over a year. It was so good I went twice in my week long trip. The spinach feta dish, Greek salad, fries with eggs and feta, orangey whipped feta app and moussaka ALLLL AMAZING. Service was efficient without feeling like you're being hovered around. My kind of place. Oh and the prices were excellent! Good food, good service and good prices.

It all starts with the location that is not what you would expect for a Greek restaurant. Hipster atmosphere and very casual, you can go with any clothes you like. Super relaxed and nice staff. I had the beet salad, it was good but ok. After that we ordered spinach pie and whole fish with lemon potato. Everything was really good. This is for 2 people and for dessert we got the baklava that was great as well. Total price U$80.

I ordered from Kiki's via grub hub this evening and found staples in my zucchini chips, I have ordered from here before being Greek and living their spanakopita the only other complaints I would have is their delivery time is bad and food needs warming, my mother was beyond disgusted and when we called Kiki's and grub hub they offered to pay for the zucchini chips, $9 out of an $81 order

A true 5 star! This was an incredible experience. Everything from the service, to that insane meat plate we got as an entree to split was SO PERFECT. Also - how in the world did we get out of there under $40 each? We had lots of wine, multiple apps, and about 4 lbs of meat. I'm not complaining! It was also very obviously a 'cool kids' spot - so I felt like a cool kid by proxy. I went with two old friends and this was the perfect place to catch up, have some belly laughs, and get increasingly meat sweaty. There is a new Greek Goddess in town and her name is Kiki.
No comment

I'm surprised to see reviews all over the place for this gem of a restaurant. My first experience here was an entirely positive one, and I couldn't stop thinking or talking about it afterward! Admittedly, I always think "Queens" whenever I crave good Greek food...well, maybe not anymore. The horiatiki (their Greek salad) is so fresh and perfect and the chicken with lemon potatoes really hit the spot. I also enjoyed the taramosalata, something I always order at Greek restaurants, and didn't have the same problem some other reviewers--bland and pale? Did we eat at the same place?--In any event, arrive early to avoid the wait that seems to be the root of so many people's disappointment in Kiki's. Come hungry and leave happy :) Perfect for an early dinner date.

Really tasty Greek place with option of Greek wine by the liter just like in Greece. Briam and other stewed vegetable dishes are well prepared and the service is friendly. Avoid peak times because it will be crowded.

I went twice in a week! Very good, high quality Greek food. I'm no Greek connoisseur but we brought my Greek friend who said it was "solid." Guess he wasn't blown away, but I sure was. Especially at such a reasonable price point. Carafes of wine (1L) are ~$24! I highly recommend the saganaki if you like savory and sweet. The octopus is also great and lemony and so so tender. Also, tzaziki is crazy good and they bring charred breads/pita for dipping. Nice ambiance, like a dimly lit cavern in Europe. Will keep this place in my top places to bring visitors to impress!

Food is great. Service is trashhhhhh. They literally all go out of their way to ignore you. There's not a single decent server there. I never got the round of drinks I asked for on top of that. Also, they let a dog inside the restaurant while people were eating. Leave that shit for the outside man.

The staff is 20 stars and beyond. Very busy at brunch tIme. There are  three rooms with say about  25 seats  in each and four waiters  working hard. they were all so pleasant and genuinely happy. Food is great. The Marousala  !? Salad is tasty- romaine chopped little tossed w dill, feta and greeen onion also choppEd  little. Every chopped romaine piece was dressed w a morsel if this. The zucchini fries are magic aNd soooo cheesy. Thinly sliced zucchin and then tempura  frIed?! To perfeCtion anD while theyy sits hot, I think small crumbly cheese is generously  sprinkled on. Lots of ggood cheese. I was able to scoop the cheese at the bottom of the basket. Loved it. Lemon potatoes have a creamy dressing. It's simple but you keep going to the potato wedge for another bitte. Red snapper gRilled was a tinY little bit over cooked but I still devoured every centimeter of this fish. The place has a rustic Barcelona-bohemian feel..... I really liked it here. I think a big part was the friendly content hard working  staff

My favorite Greek sit down spot in the city! Always has killer service, wine, and not to mention food (literally have not ordered something I didnt like from here). One of my favorite places to show off when people come to visit not to mention a wonderful date night experience. ily kikis

I've been loving Kiki's long before Drake wondered if the feeling was mutual. They're doing an awesome job of keeping the vibes high, the music great, and the food delicious, which is especially appreciated during this tough time of the pandemic. Tons of options for both meat eaters and vegetarians. Everything tastes great here but no matter what you get, you have to get a side of fries. Other faves include the shrimp, the fava dip, and the maroulosalata.

Not enough compliments for this spot. My favorite Greek restaurant with a warm atmosphere...uncomplicated, homestyle and satisfying. Have taken many friends here and they all love it. They have big tables for large groups but I love just sitting at the end of the bar too. Menu favorites are the sautéed shrimp with ouzo anice cream sauce, grilled octopus, Horiatiki Greek Salad, moussaka, whole broiled fish, creamy golden split pea purée with tomato onion sauce and capers and the Melitzanosalata smoky mashed eggplant with crushed walnuts
