unexpected, excellent intimate atmosphere with large outdoor area. great cocktails and food, especially loved the yellowtail ceviche and the poached lobster. the duck breast was fantastic, particularly the stuffed heirloom corn dough. best tortillas i've had.

The thing I love most about living in Williamsburg is that when I think I've been to any restaurant worth visiting, I'm proven wrong on every occasion. My friend recommended Aldama when for lunch after we had spent the morning at Domino Park. I hadn't heard of the restaurant but my friend only had glowing things to say about it. We walked about 10 minutes from the park to the restaurant which is located in south Williamsburg. Aldama is a modern Mexican restaurant that's ideal for a special night out. The spot is on the smaller side with a large bar and table seating around that. When it came time to order we decided to get the guacamole as well as an assortment of canasta and trompo tacos which were amazing. We also had the house margarita which was equally exceptional. Come here if you find yourself in the area with a craving for quality Mexican dishes!

Mmmmm. Meh. The drinks here are a little better than cocktails you'll get at most spots, but they're still not worth the $18 a cocktail costs at this point. It's also kind of silly that the Happy Hour only applies to the bar, but I just think that concept is lame in general. The food was tasty but what small portions! Their take on a carne asada taco was delicious, but overall there's nothing here to ever bring me back, unless my lovely girlfriend wants me to.

The dining room is zen boho like, the food is like I am sitting in Mexico City, and the drinks are unique. Really loved the service here and the food while celebrating my birthday here. That said they have a strict max on how long you can sit at the table which blows when you are with a larger party

Very cute ambience, good music and nice service. The food thought is a bit disappointing. Chicken with mole was just sweet and lacked some freshness in all the dishes. Some vegetables would be great. The tacos were tasty but again fresh pineapples would be better than pineapple sauce.

No comment

This place is pretty unassuming when you first enter, you'd think this place was just a small bar with a few seats but when you get taken through to the seating area you'll see there is more indoor and outdoor seating. My friend made a reservation for Saturday at 5:30 and we were able to be seated right away. All the staff was very nice, we really liked the ambiance and the decor, one thing that was funny was the little water cup, now they did keep our cups filled but it was just enough to take a swallow of water before someone had to come back around and fill it up again. Now this menu is very unique and besides some things like guacamole this menu looked nothing like I'd ever seen in a Mexican restaurant, now that's not really a bad thing because the food was really good and of great quality, we got the guacamole which instead of being served with tortilla chips was served with 3 tortillas that were of the same consistency of a chip, no complaints it was great and had a little spice to it, you can tell they didn't over do it with salt and instead used herbs and spices, that's important to me. We got the duck appetizer which was unique and good, we also got the Taco De Trompo which also was good but really $9 for a taco? Now it was unique I have to give them that but really overpriced in my opinion, we shared the Asado which is a 26 oz steak, it's served with some cheese with fig we think and tortillas also with a green sauce, now the quality of this steak is great, well flavored but not overly seasoned and can easily be shared by 3-4 people, you definitely pay a lot for it but it's good, what I didn't like is when we finished the tortillas and were offered more we expected that it would be complimentary considering the amount we paid for it but I was disappointed later to see that we were charged for it, now in comparison to the price of the total bill it was small change but it's the principle in my mind, this is a unique place that is very pricey but it's also unlike any Mexican place I've been to before, the drinks are pricey as well, it's a good place to check out but for my budget I couldn't come here too often.
No comment

Come for happy hour!! Drinks are around 10$ and there are food specials as well! Otherwise wasn't too pleased with my actual meal. We ordered gauc and chips- the avocado was not ripe so there were big hard pieces in my gauc. Then for a party of 5 they gave us 4 chips. I also don't like these new "chips" which were small whole corn tortillas (so then you just break it up yourself). Didn't make sense for a big bowl of gauc. The mezcal based frozen drink was delicious but it went from 10$ to 14/15$? Same size, that's ridiculous. Come for happy hour otherwise not sure if it's worth your time. Nothing else we ate was really worth mentioning.

Great new addition in the Williamsburg area. Stopped by here with a friend to check it out and had a great time! The guacamole was outstanding and the cocktails were fantastic and worth trying. The happy hour was worth checking out, the server Vivian was very hospitable!
No comment
Excellent food! Amazing drinks , don't miss happy hours  high recommend, nice music good vibes

Best tacos de trompo in nyc. Everything is super fresh and delicious. Definitely recommend
No comment

I came here yesterday for my friends birthday. I told the waiter that I had a peanut allergy, and he told me the only item we ordered that had peanuts was the guacamole. We ordered a variety of shared plates, including the cornish hen. I ended up having a horrible allergic reaction and had to go to the emergency room. We were supposed to go to a concert that evening that I spent 120 dollars on, but I instead could not go and spent 300 dollars on an emergency room visit. I am very disappointed in this service.

The food here is pretty good we had the lobster and chicken.  They drinks were good as well I had a Mt. Fuji similar to a Margarita.  Seating outdoor is nice however flies and mosquitos are a bit of a nuisance hence the reason for 4 stars.  Overall great vibe and ambience check it out!

This incredible meal is definitely one of the top restaurants in Williamsburg. Food highlights: Taco de Trompo, Hamachi and Tacos de canasta.  The setting and music were perfect and the staff was helpful and informative.

Aldama was truly an experience. The staff was more than generous and the food was delicious. They have devine vegan options and not to mention the guacamole and cocktails are to die for. Cannot wait to return again!
No comment

Let me start with the Daykon tostadas they were amazing and the service is tje best !   From beginning to end. Drinks are strong and delicious ! Great selection of mezcal, I love the decorations!  Special thanks to William for your hospitality. We did not have a reservation but he went out of his way to accommodate us!
Cozy place, great vibes, awesome staff, gourmet food. Willie was very accommodating to our needs and an excellent host.
What an INCREDIBLE meal! Wonderful cocktails, amazing food, excellent service. Prices are comparable to any nice New York/BK meal. Ambiance is great. Highly recommend!
No comment

This was probably the best Mexican food I have had outside of CDMX. We started with the tacos de canasta, yellowfin ceviche, and taco de trompo. All were phenomenal in their own ways, but the taco de trompo was probably the best taco I have had -- and this is from someone who adores tacos de trompo and al pastor tacos like no one I've ever met. Completely worth the price, was an experience that left me only wanting more, which in this case is a good thing. At the end I had to shake the chefs hands, because as many know, their creativity often goes unappreciated.
Sind at night was so welcoming!  Food and drinks is amazing bud service is wonderful. This is my favorite restaurant in Brooklyn. What a great experience. Thank you for a amazing dinner experience!
No comment

Top notch. I don't usually write reviews, but I can't begin to emphasize how good this meal was start to finish. Everyone who works here-A++++, the food-not just delicious, but filled with integrity, authenticity...the commitment to story.
No comment
No comment
No comment

thursday night with not reservation .. But they were very excited to have us. Mg and host were very welcoming!! food is amazing. octopus is a not missing plate. thanks for a great dining experience!!!
My new favorite gem !!!  Excellent service !!  Best chicken I'd ever had!!   Great selection of mezcal and the Asian hostess was nice and friendly. !!  I can't wait to come back for brunch

I absolutely love this place . I was there on Thursday with my boyfriend and we had a great time .  The food was awesome ,tasty  drinks and amazing service. I will be back to try their brunch . I definitely recommend this place . 5 stars from me and my bf. Keep it up the great work, Aldama

This place has a lot to be said in its favor: great staff, drinks, ambiance. However. Many vegans and vegetarians will come here for the vegan mole - which is a dish one basically never comes across, it's practically an oxymoron. This restaurant makes a big deal about this dish. It's the most expensive on the menu. And it is awful. Besides being almost nothing other than mole - a few tiny  mushrooms, that's it - the mole tastes burnt with a charcoal aftertaste. No one at my table found anything positive to say about it. And two of us found it repugnant enough to stop eating entirely. So disappointing!
Great ambience!!   Food is amazing!! Service is friendly and professional. Drinks :  try the sangre de mezcal !! Lo love the music !!

Underwhelming... Maybe since it was a soft opening ( I hope), I'll give them another shot in a couple of months.  I got duped by the nyeater article prior to visiting. "Despite his history serving drinks at top-tier restaurants, Reyes wants Aldama to be an approachable, everyday hangout. "I don't want to have a hundred different tequilas and mezcals on our wall," he says. Instead, the bar is focusing on 10 bottles of each, available for sipping from copitas with slices of oranges. A happy hour -- 5 to 7 p.m. daily -- advertises frozen margaritas and beer and mezcal shot combos for $10 or less.".....  There was no mezcal selection, only one cocktail list with 6 drinks ($14 each), one with mezcal....and it was frozen...I'd assume since the founder of the establishment is a bartender, the drinks would be more impressive...to each their own. Food menu was short as well and did not wow me either (and we ordered everything with the exception of the guacamole) There are only 2 meat options on the menu, both are small plates.  One is the cecina; thinly sliced, dried, crispy filet( think beef jerky meets chicharron) and the tacos- very good!  As explained by our server, the corn is imported de Mexico and milled in house! Growing pains... I'm sure they'll right the ship... Go here and you'll see what I'm talking about.

I ordered today from door dash expecting it to be really juicy and tender and the portion I got was mostly the fatty pieces. I asked for medium rare and I got it more on the medium well side. I could've definitely gotten a better steak somewhere else for $38 and the wait to receive the food took a really long time too. Waste of my money.

Me and my friends were really hungry and we found this place on Maps so we tried and it was great! It's open until late, food has a lot flavor and the sizes are pretty big. Service was amazing! Tomo and Meho I don't know if I'm writing your names correctly but we appreciated your service! I was full and I took the rest to home! Also prices are reasonable. Definitely I would come back.
This place is awesome, fast service, the food was amazing, mijo and tomo take care in my table and they were really kind and patience with us, definitely I will back here

If you're in the mood for some delicious Japanese cuisine, I highly recommend trying Ichibantei. Although I've never actually dined in at the restaurant, their takeout is consistently good, and their dishes never disappoint. From my frequent orders, I can say that their Karaage, Agedashi, and Ichibantei steak are must-tries. The steak, in particular, is always cooked well and pairs well with a dry sake. Despite the occasional mishap in delivery, the food is always of high quality and is reasonably priced. I appreciate their consistent food quality, making it my go-to spot for a late-night Uber Eats order. If you're looking for comfort food that hits the spot, give Ichibantei a try.

Great food, good service and a cozy little outdoor cabin to enjoy our meal. If your looking for a meal under $20 this is your place ! We ordered the Chicken Nanban, and the Garlic Chicken which came with rice , salad and a side of miso soup. Each entree was $15.99 and it was plenty of food ! The chicken was flavorful, moist and well prepared. Our server was attentive and made sure we had everything we needed. Only downside is the have limited seating outdoor only but are opening up indoor dining in the next 2 weeks. If your in the area this is a great spot to grab food with friends, family or even a date night.

column1: A K I K O B.
column6: I crave their katsudon so often it's crazy. I also had their calamari and it was so good, big portion too! I had leftovers :)

I eat at Ichibantei so much, the least I can do is leave them with a 5-star review. I've tried a couple things on the menu such as the Katsu and Okayo Don, the Kaarage, and tuna steak (all super delicious!!!) but nothing compares to their niku udon bowl. The broth is perfect, they don't shy away from piling up the beef and everything meshes together so well. I've had the niku udon more times than I can count and I will continue to do so because Ichibantei is consistent with their delivery of home cooked goodness.
No comment

Super cute authentic Japanese restaurant that cooks Japanese comfort food. They have outdoor seatings, but in the warmer weather if you are magnet for bugs maybe avoid. Love the decor inside with the vinyl disc and the music and vibe of the place. The staff are friendly and great with recommendations. They have draft Sapporo beer!!! Enjoy the meals and app and felt like I went to a Japanese household and had a home cooked meal.

Went here to eat with a couple of friends and after we were seated, the same waiter who seated us was nowhere to be found. After 20mins of waiting, we just decided to go somewhere else to eat and that's when the waiter decided to show up to ask us "oh you're leaving?" with a slight smirk on his face. It was obvious that they just didn't want to serve us, which was a shame because we were excited to try this place. Don't give them business.
Good quick eat, sat outdoors, waiter was very nice, food was delicious, try their ramen , they are open late also

Great takeout, will definitely need to come for a late night snack. The Udon portion was big and the tempura rice was a nice crunchy addition. We also ordered gyoza, which were standard--hard to mess up. The pork tonkotsu was also delicious, although portion was smaller than some other places I've ordered from.

No comment
I found this place years ago when I lived in Stuytown. Best Katsu don in NYC so far. Great customer service. Im a regular even though I now have to drive there from Midtown. Never disappoint.

Super delicious food, very fast walking distance or I can ride my bike in lock it on a pole or something. It's just leaving full in a little drunk with my bike  after the food service and ambiance is very upscale. Room filled with Japanese people of varies multi culture backgrounds. I always loved diversity when it comes to cooking.

The food is probably more like a 3.5 but in terms of service it's almost like they're trying to make it as hard as possible on you to order. If you order in person they'll make you wait outside in the freezing cold, if you try to order by phone they won't take the order, if you order online they don't estimate the preparation time accurately. So overall with other options in the neighborhood it's hard to justify coming here.
Nice spot for a later night bite! Small menu but super fresh and yummy food! And plenty of sake options!
Good prices and ambiance. Really chill place to hang and have some drinks. Casual but has great a Japanese dishes.

just had the weirdest experience here. the guy was so rude to us from the second we walked up, he had already given us attitude but we were starving so we decided to get togo food. (his name is Tomoya idk if that is the correct spelling) brings out the receipt and had added something to our order we never said and when we pointed it out he basically yelled at us, rolled his eyes and stomped to the kitchen yelling came back and had an entirely different item on our bill, we questioned it and he flipped out again so we just said fuck it and left. I wouldn't recommend going and god forbid you ask for an extra side of sauce cause that's also out of the question

4 stars because most our orders from uber eats gets to us in wet paper bags with spills. Other than that, this is one of our go to place , comfort food. We order always the inchiban steak,  agedashi and karaage.  Food always tastes great, quality consistent!

Found them on Yelp because they open until 3am. We spent $30 to Uber there after hitting a few bars, arrived at 2:20am. The waiter "respectfully" told us they no longer take dine-in customers, take out only. Couldn't stand the attitude, walked a few blocks to The Halal Guys.

We were looking for a place to eat Saturday night after seeing a show. So many places close so early but we lucked out finding this  restaurant. Everything was so delicious and fresh. We ate and had drinks and the bill was $45 dollars! What a bargain. Will definitely be back and it's open late!

Fantastic Japanese comfort food with the best chicken nanban! Pre covid I came here before and enjoyed sitting in this long bench restaurant with bob marley theme chill vibes. Recently I got takeout and got the chicken nanban and karaage. The chicken nanban is comfort food because it's affordable, not too greasy of a chicken, but bites full of meat and juicy too! Goes so well with the rice and the egg like sauce that I just devour. Karaage was big and meaty. The tako wasa here was good too!

East village gem! Best chicken nanban you can get. My friends from out of town always ask to come here.

Delicious food and a great place to come for a late night snack and drink! Pretty small interior makes for a cozy atmosphere. The chicken karaage meal was delicious and really hit the spot late at night.

The food was wonderful.  Dumplings, and I got the sliced sushi grade tuna steak - great!!!  It is not big on atmosphere, but a great find for the hungry late at night!

This was my go-to for all 4 years of uni, and I can confidently say I've never had fried chicken as good as this place does it. The owner is fantastic and the oyakodon is top tier, plus they're open late enough for night owls/insomniacs like myself to visit for dinner. Honestly, this restaurant is what I miss the most any time I have to leave NYC.

We came here from Uni around the block and decided to get the chicken katsu and pork chop. The chicken katsu was crispy, well-seasoned, and juicy. Some of the best if not the best chicken katsu I have ever had. Definitely recommend to stop by 10/10.

Pretty average Japanese spot with great donburi bowls and inexpensive cocktails . The donburi comes with the meat and egg separate from the rice and sits on top of a concentrated broth. The broth itself was packed with intense flavor . I suggest separating the meat from the broth so it doesn't get soggy sitting in it . The seating was very dark during the day wish they had lights inside the Booths outside ...

Great place to get fast and delicious Japanese food! Service was excellent and very friendly. I highly recommend the Ichibantei steak and the hamburger steak if you ever stop by. Also, try the Yuzu Sour cocktail! Due to covid restriction, we sat outside in a cozy enclosed booth with heaters and the option to close a sliding door if it was cold outside; it was a very "homey" feel. 10/10
Best ramen late night vibes this place is the one. The beef ramen has so much flavor.plus it's open till 2am

The menu is simple to navigate and the food tasted very fresh. The dishes were somewhat bland, so I added a lot of the spice seasoning to give it some flavor. The portions were generous, and overall prices were fair. It wasn't the best Japanese food I've had, but for location and all things considered--I'd go again.

Rude service. Came here at 2am with 3 friends and we ordered 3 items. Waiter rudely let us know there was a $10 minimum purchase required per person. We let him know our total was over $40+, then he proceeded to tell us it's actually a $15 minimum per person. Most rude experience I've ever had in any restaurant.
Ordered at 2AM, food arrived on time, packaged well, tasted great. Got the sweet and sour chicken (chicken chaap), I recommend it. Will be trying other items

Worth a try. First time I had the chicken it was immaculate and a 5 star meal. Second time I had it, a few of the pieces were undercooked. Giving it the benefit of the doubt

Ridiculously delicious food, friendly and attentive service, and fantastic prices. The frozen cocktails are also delicious!

Food is 5 star and ambiance is 2 star. But we would absolutely go back for the food! Service was good also.

Great little spot a fast casual dining experience. I ordered the traditional chicken which came with a side of rice and salad and ordered calamari! The calamari was unbelievable fresh and fried to perfection. The salad was amazing and the dressing had a great savory flavor. The chicken was delish but wasn't as crunchy as I would have expected and lacked any real seasoning. I do wish they had sauce to do it in!

I love this place. They serve the most comforting katsudon in a large portion size, for a good price, and deliver late!

Lovely new discovery in the east village.  Japanese steak bento was to die for.  Pork tonkatsu tasted great but it was a little tough to chew.  Friendly staff.  Definitely will come back for more.

Food came cold (this is probably more delivery app's fault). Steak was well done and chewy. Tuna was better, but just okay. This place is not a fancy looking place but it accomplishes what you want, good food!  The staff is friendly and their food comes out quickly.  It's just like in Japan, the place doesn't look fancy but delivers good food!

This is probably one of my favorite places in NYC. A Japanese restaurant that plays Jamaican reggae/old school reggae music - it doesn't get any better! Came with my boyfriend and we ordered the yuzu sake and blackened sausage. Absolutely delicious! Cannot wait to come back in the winter!

Ordered here the first time because I was craving for fried chicken at midnight.  And OMG it was so good and people here are so nice .  From that time on, we order over and over for everything on the menu - so simple and so delicious.  So good
No frills restaurant with awesome juicy crispy fried chicken. The rice was the perfect texture and salad tasted delicious too! Casual outdoor seating with plexiglass between some of the tables.

More like 3.5/5. Like a very standard comfort Japanese shokutei restaurant. Sort of like a local bar you just like to hang in for the atmosphere and convenience. I would say the steak is expensive for how it was cooked.

Ordered takeout during Covid19. Loved going here in person when we could. Delicious authentic Japanese comfort food. Quick delivery. Reasonably priced. No need though :(. Had kaarage - delicious as always. Hamburger steak - the sauce is still the bomb. Definitely will continue ordering here! Can't wait to go back in person too.

Good food and music. Good vibes, place is a little small/ cramped. But good otherwise. Favorites here: garlic ramen and chicken nanban (fried chicken). Open late so that's a bonus. And big chilled mugs of beer!

Foods are good. I got delivery. Steak was not the best tasting but did the job. The salad and rice were great sides and tasted good. The sauce for the salad and the steak added flavor to the food. If I had to eat here again I would eat just for the sauces. I have had the other foods here as well. All the foods have decent taste and maybe because it was delivered the foods were not as good because the heat has dissipated and some were soggy. Overall it was good to satisfy a food craving and when NYC lockdown/quarantine is over I may try the restaurant in person to get the true taste

I'm a little confused trying to figure out if this place is worth the prices or not. Sometimes I hink it is, other times I feel the opposite. Tonight was good. I got delivered the katsudon and the calamari app. I like that the calamari wasn't greasy, though it is big pieces and chewy. The katusdon, similarly, was not as tender as I've had, but it also wasn't greasy, so I'm happy with this. Thumbs up

Came here for some late night food around 2AM. Love that it's open late. It's small and dark. There's a TV (playing sports), and reggae albums on the walls. The tables and chairs are high and hard - fine for drinks but slightly uncomfortable for eating. The food is great though. I highly recommend the Cold Ramen Noodles + Chicken Nanban. Just could not get enough. Some places have cold ramen but the noodles are way too chewy. This place has got it down just right. Chicken is super flavorful and tasty. Add a beer to top it off.

Came here before attending a concert at Irving Plaza. We were some of the first customers in and were served very quickly. We ordered a bunch of appetizers including the karaage and the octopus (which was interesting to say the least- don't order it without asking what it is haha). For my entree I had the garlic chicken. All in all it was a delicious but really filling meal.

This place is outrageously good for takeout. Currently sipping the Niku Udon Noodle and it is just... chef's kiss. Haven't been here IRL so can't vouch for that. They are open late during the pandemic, which is most appreciated.

I REALLY wanted to love this place but there were a few glaring issues. First of all I ordered pickup and requested 5:30; they called to confirm and while I asked for a little earlier they said they could only do 5:30 so I agreed. Basically I didnt walk out of there until about 5:50 which was really annoying. They were somewhat apologetic but they weren't really rushing at all. In addition they could have thrown something in to show that they were apologetic but alas nothing. I also asked them to make sure the order was right and of course when I got home and opened it up they got an order wrong which should have been porkbelly but was another chicken. Regarding the food I don't know if the chicken wouldve been crispy if you order at the restaurant but when I got home the chickens was marginally crispy and the flavor wasn't anything special. I love their menu choices but none of it was really awesome. I doubt I would come back but hope they can fix up their dishes and service. Try out their online ordering for 20% off.

Great ambiance. Love the reggae music in the background. Food was excellent. Wife had the ramen noodle soup and I had the seared tuna. Both were delicious. Owner is very friendly and provided excellent service.

We had their fried chicken, wagyu hamburger, katsu don, and soy garlic chicken. Everything was a bit too sweet for me but everything tasted good. Their portions are small but their food isn't expensive so I guess that is okay. It came with white rice and a plate of salad. The salad dressing was great!
Delicious katsu don! Fun Reggae themed atmosphere. A tad on the pricey side but not to bad.
Staff was super friendly and kept checking to see if we were doing okay! Food was delicious and drinks were great! Love the small environment of this place

This place is incredible! It's usually not too crowded and the garlic chicken is amazing. The teriyaki chicken is also amazing! The entrees come with chicken and salad and rice and soup and it's a really good deal. Also, $5 Sapporo! Highly recommend.

Excellent quality delivery. Packaging was tight, clean, and of sturdy quality. The food was delicious. Probably the best delivery tonkatsu I've ever had.

Friends brought me to this cool little spot and I really loved the vibe. Once you go in, there are a good amount of seats, and what's pretty cool is that they play reggae music. There was only one man serving us, so it wasn't the fastest service. I tried the Chicken Nanban which is chicken with sweet & sour sauce and their homemade tartar sauce. The entree also comes with a bowl of miso soup (really good but was a bit too salty) and a salad (very fresh and the dressing was pretty good). The nanban itself was not bad, but for me it lacked a bit flavor and the chicken was a bit soggy. I think this place definitely has potential though. Maybe their ramen is better? I actually came here wanting to try their ramen, but they said they sold out the ramen and I came here at 8:15 PM?..so I will be back again to give it one more try!

Cash only place! But so worth it! I support fully. They work very hard to keep the food and services consistent. I respect that! The foods are very delicious and pls look at the photos for references!
I love this spot. The karaage is excellent and they have a good selection of sake in cans. Super friendly staff too!

Pretty solid. Homestyle cooking which can really fill a niche in the area. Get the chicken and the egg, nom

It has been awhile since I've had a bad experience at a restaurant. First I ask for the wifi and the guy working here gives me a spotty response saying it's only for employees. Cool I get it. My friend orders something and then changes her mind shortly after to downsize it from large to medium. The guy comes out with the large AND a medium and then tells us then that it's too late. My friend tries to clarify that she said she downsized it. How you about to scam us by giving us TWO orders of a large AND medium when she clearly said she just wanted one order for herself?! The worker continues to give some attitude with a b***h face saying too bad it's too late it came out. We're like ok we get it. Then 5 minutes later he comes and taps my friend on the shoulder and says we're gonna have to charge you for that you know just to rub it in. Serious? Just my two cents for future visitors. Gave 2 stars instead of 1 cuz the food wasn't too bad.
Love this restaurant! The burger and Nanban are awesome, and the delivery is always on time from my experiences

Awesome place for late night dining and very cool atmosphere. Got off the plane, unloaded our gear in the apartment and went off to find a cool spot with good food. Yelp is great! That's why we're here! I had the chicken nanbann along with a seaweed soup that filled me up and the flavors were amazing!
Cash only and overpriced. Food is okay but not beyond the average level of Japanese restaurants. They close very late and it's a good place for late night snacks.

This place primarily sells donburis and meat with rice dishes. Very good, casual restaurant with a cool reggae theme.

I ordered katsu don takeout from this place as I was craving Japanese comfort food, but the other place I wanted food from does not do takeout, so I decided to try this place because it was close by. The restaurant has this cool hip hop vibe to it. They own the wall space next to the restaurant, and there's a huge mural with their name on it, so it's not that hard to spot the place. The restaurant has a couple of large wooden tables with stools that would be good for large groups or otherwise communal seating. The place struck me as authentically Japanese, and the employees were really nice, but the katsu don was just meh. I saw that the other fried chicken dishes were more popular, but I'd had enough fried chicken for one week, so I went with pork. Hopefully, the chicken is much better than the pork. I definitely want to come back to try the chicken when I have a craving for it.

I love this spot. It has a chill Japanese hipster vibe reminiscent of one of the random spots you could find in Tokyo. The chicken nanban is phenomenal and the beers are served very cold and cheap.
Relatively inexpensive dinner. I liked the presentation and food. I ordered the garlic chicken but I'm looking forward to trying the fried chicken next time.

I LOVE Japanese food, and frequently cook it at home so I was excited to try this place since it's so close. Usually when my boyfriend and I go to an expensive NY restaurant for the first time we share a plate since they range from $15-$25 per plate and the check can go up to the $60s for a lunch. When we stopped in here we were going to try the wagyu, and when were about to be seated in the empty booth section, the waiter told us we had to order an entree for each of us if we wanted to eat there. I understand covid precautions, but I have never been to a restaurant that forces you to individually buy plates unless it was a buffet (understandably). I'm disappointed that during a pandemic when everyone is low on cash, and restaurants are already struggling, this restaurant forces you to have your own $15-$25 plate of food just to eat there. I won't be going there anytime soon, but may one day I'll check back to see if they changed their policy.

The food here is good for sure! I would be hesitant to say that it was one of the best Japanese places in the city. I ordered their signature dish, and I found it to be a bit too fatty for my liking. However, they keep their prices low and are definitely good at capturing that signature Japanese izakaya vibe.

I do think that separating the rice and the dish as they do is far more practical than originally thought.

Hamburger steak is very good. Ordered from here since 3 years ago and never failed. Also fried chicken is very good.

Decent but a bit overpriced. Also, this store has an exorbitant amount of delivery fee (don't get tricked by the "1.49" they add a % if your food cost). If you want a good Japanese restaurant you can get better food for same price all around NY.

Hands down my favorite place in New York City. It's a teeny tiny place that always has reggae music and Japanese decor. The food is always great but not what you would typically get from a traditional Japanese place hence the self proclaimed "Japanese soul food". The service has always been super accommodating since they're cash only as well as friendly. They also are opened super late and always have $5 GIANT mugs of Japanese beer. To say this place is a hidden gem would be an understatement.

I used to like this place a lot, but after recently dining here last night, I noticed a decline in food quality. The fried calamari was so salty, as well as the pork katsu don I had. And the rice was not soft and fluffy at all. It seemed like it was sitting out and was hard and chewy. Sad to say, I won't be coming back here anytime soon.

Divey and cash-only. The karaage is huge pieces of chicken. The ramen is ok, nothing special. It comes with pork, half an egg, seaweed, and bamboo shoots. It's a huge portion though. A good backup plan, but I probably wouldn't return.

Lousy. The food is mediocre at best on a good day. The staff has really gone downhill since the guy with the hat left. I will never return. Used to get delivery a lot and once upon a time it was decent. The past few times I've tried it the food arrived cold and was bordering on inedible. If you like wasting money and being treated like garbage this is the place for you. If you want good food and to be treated with a little respect I suggest you try anywhere else.

We are here very often! CASH ONLY! Authentic Japanese Soul foods with reggae music playing in the background. You can't beat that!!! The entire staff is super friendly and attentive to your every need. Must get their Garlic Chicken, ChickenChup chicken, Ramen, Tuna Steak, Potato Salad, Agedashi Tofu. Portions are big so make sure you come with an empty stomach!!

It's open late, friendly staff, small and cozy restaurant, interesting menu, big portions, fresh food.

OK - I'm a next door neighbor, so I'll admit some bias - the owners are super friendly and eager to please.  This is a cozy location, with windows open to the street - walls covered with reggae albums, and excellent reggae playlists from the afficiando owners.  Ice cold pint mugs of Sapporo are always $5.  The food is excellent, with multiple small plates and premium entrees.  My faves are the burdock appetizer and the grilled tuna which is seared outside and pink inside with a delicious miso based dressing...
Living on 14th & B, this place is totally a gem for our apt. Just love this place. Cash only is annoying otherwise I would love to come here everyday

Honestly I don't know how this place has such high ratings, maybe they are paying Yelp to boost their ratings. This place serves disgusting food for expensive prices. Starting from their tempura, which is soggy and undercooked, to the Don bowls, which are way too watery, with rice that is obviously made and reheated. They even put soggy salad with leaves that are wilting on a plate. The hamburger steak smells sour, like meat that has been refrigerated for an obscene amount of time topped off with a even worse sweet and sour sauce that makes ketchup on steak look spectacular. Listen to me, if you have come here because of the 4 star average review, you will not be satisfied with the actual result of the restaurant.
Just wanted to grab a drink. We were 8 people, only 6 ordered a drink and we were asked to leave. Nobody was waiting outside and there was another free table. Definitely not coming back.

This is my goto when ordering comp'd dinner at work.  I get the chicken with the stuff on top.  It's good.  Real good.  Eat it.  I've never actually paid out of pocket for this place though.  I wonnder if I'd still like it as much?

Whenever I need to escape the horror of New York's humans, I visit Ichibantei. The cool reggae beats soothe my raging spirits, and the donburi fills me with happy, sleepy feelings. The staff are courteous to the extreme and the restaurant is warm and gentle. Ichibantei - I love you. New York gamma males, not so much.

I already knew this place had great comfort Japanese food. I ordered late night Chicken Nanban, which is amazing, but they forgot my order and made me wait an hour. I called, and when the order actually came they added some drinks and a Chicken Karagei. Forgiven. Great service and great food deserves 5 stars.

This is my third time ordering from the restaurant. If you order for delivery, be prepared for a long wait. The wait time is extremely inconsistent. My order usually arrives in 30 minutes. However recently it takes over an hour. But the quality of the food is great. Everything is well flavored and authentic. I would recommend the following dishes: Katsudon and Chicken Nanban.
No comment
Best Japanese restaurant in Manhattan. Had the chicken nanban and it was delicious. The service was really good too, definitely will be coming back here!!

Awesome Japanese comfort food and Karage style chicken. The tacowasu (Raw Octopus with wasabi) was a generous portion. The Nanban chicken was fantastic and the $5 ice cold Sapporo was a crowd favorite. Affordable late night food with Reggae spinning. It is like if you were in a Japanese surfer izakaya. Staff are cool and the food is great.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
I like this place!  Super chill spot tucked away with reasonable prices and qhat seems to be basic but good food. I only had a drink here but i will be back.  Cash only though!

We had the ramen and tako-wasa. The broth of ramen is spot on. It has pork flavor in it and taste awesome. We also had the mini sausage appertizer and tako-wasa. Tako-wasa is a wasabi flavor raw octopus appertizer. It is very fresh and chewy. A lot of people may not like this type of flavor, but I found it very authentic. The decor of Ichibantei is like all the other restaurants in East Village, and it is more like a bar. Overall great experience! :)
No comment
No comment
Good food but cash only which quickly becomes a minus when you are not always carrying cash around.

Absolutely wonderful! Came here around midnight on a Saturday night after getting in from DC-- great that they're open so late! The ramen & karaage combo was delicious and piping hot when it came out. For $17, it was quite a large amount of food, which I appreciated after having not eaten for 12 hours. The seating is kind of bar-style, with hooks underneath the table for your jackets/bags. They play interesting reggae/Caribbean music in the background and the service was very nice and fast. Definitely making this place one of my go-tos in NY.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Came here the other night because I live in the neighborhood and wanted to try the Japanese fried chicken. Waited 15 minutes before I was given water and was treated to mediocre service for the rest of the meal. The food was not great either. When I closed the check I left a 19% tip because I work the service industry and you never know what's happening behind the scene. The waiter came back and complained I didn't "tip him enough, I only tipped 10%". I had to count the bills out in front of him to show him that I actually left a $19 tip on the bill in spite of the bad service. I felt annoyed and embarrassed. In ten years as a server I have never ever asked anyone for an extra tip. I will not return!

Everything that I've ever ordered from Ichibantei has been delicious. With the surprising amount of mediocre Americanized Japanese restaurants, Ichibantei is truly a hidden gem! From the storefront, it looks like a bar, but there are many authentic offerings from Kurobata Tonkatasu to Chicken Nanban. While these recipes or dishes aren't exactly innovative, everything is always executed to perfection. Their fusion concept of "Japanese Soul Food" translates not only in the comforting food, but the intimate ambience. The restaurant holds about 15 seats that are seated bar-style around the center of the restaurant. The restaurant also exclusively plays reggae music and has a wall full of record album art(very soulful lol). To put it off the top, every time I've ordered delivery, the food arrived promptly and was delivered by the nicest delivery man I've ever encountered. Definitely one of my favorite spots to eat lately.
No comment
No comment

Yummy karaage! I ordered the nanbaan and it was really good. My boyfriend ordered tonkatsu. Compared to mine and the nature of the pork cutlet, his was understandably drier but he still enjoyed it very much. The wait for the food was a little long...maybe 30 minutes? But I think it was worth it. The Bob Marley in the back was great! I loved it.

Great food with a great price. Anything I've gotten is well executed and the serving size is valuable. The atmosphere is so cool, reggae vinyls on the walls with reggae tunes in the background. Service is great too, whether in store or via delivery!
No comment
The delivery service is extremely slow. I live only a couple blocks away and both times I have ordered from them it took well over an hour.
They always serve beer in the frozen cold mug, just like a cozy Izakaya in Japan.
No comment

Not happy at all with Food. The Karage and teriyaki chicken looks the same, greasy fat deep fried with a lil sauce. The mixed vegetables that come with is a cup of lettuce with soy sauce. Don't waste your money on this place.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

This place is simply a gem. I have been here dozens of time and food is always good, you can probably order closed eyes and you won't be disappointed. The place has charm and staff always nice. I definitely recommend if you are looking for a place to chill.

Solid food but the interior is a little low scale -- a pretty tight fit with large shared tables.  Not a place where you might bring a first or second date to, basically, but eat with friends or just hang.  The wait staff was really helpful and knowledgeable.
Chicken Nanban is my jam here. Just enough flavor not to over power the chicken! Eat some sausages as a good compliment and down that with a beer! Perfecto!!!
Everything was fresh and delightfully tasty. I've eaten  plenty of katsu. This is probably the best I've had. It's not too heavy and simply tasty.  Worth the look.
No comment
No comment
They forced us to pay 20% gratuity and on top of that harassed us for one person out of 12 not ordering something. Completely rude and disrespectful
Stoner owner bad attitude. Food Ma Ma. Waitress asked 5 times for something. Not stoned just bad. Stay away.

I went with a few friends on a Friday night, and to our surprise, the restaurant was completely empty. We followed the reviews and ordered tonkatsu, chicken nanban, and karaage. They were all juicy with the perfect amount of crispiness. My favorite was the chicken nanban. It is true that the service is a bit slow, but the staff is extremely friendly and attentive.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Have been here a few times and have always had a great experience.  Food is very good and beer is cheap.   Sake selection is good too.  Note that it is cash only, though.

Fantastic food and atmosphere. Took my girlfriend here for our first anniversary dinner and we agreed it was the best non-home cooked meal of our lives. Got the teriyaki ramen with ichibantei steak and the gf got the fried pork. Comes with a bunch of rice and miso soup. Get the sapporo beer!
No comment

So I was super pumped to try this place since it was sold to me as Japanese Soul Food. But I'm guessing it wasn't the traditional soul food I was thinking of (i.e. fried chicken, ribs, mac n' cheese, etc.) and more so along the lines of Japanese comfort food. It's a small place and definitely reminded me of Japan but when I tasted the Kara-age...I just wasn't impressed. It was just OK. I was over at Jin Ramen earlier that day and tried the boneless fried chicken, which was super delicious. My other friends really liked their food so maybe I just didn't order the right thing. If there's a next time, I'll try the Chicken Nanban.

I have to downgrade the rating. I previously complained that the food was on the pricey side, and they've recently increased their prices again.  Although I like their food and the staff is so polite and friendly, I would love to support them but it's no longer an every day option for me.
No comment
No comment

There is a ridiculous rule about people not being able to share meals. We were harassed and guilted by one of the employees because a couple we were with decided to share a plate. Worst service I have received in a long time.
No comment

No credit cards. No alcohol served (though they did let us bring wine in). The menu is extremely limited. I was there with a group of about 10 people, and several had a lot of trouble finding something they wanted. I wanted a chicken dish or a vegetable dish: the latter was nonexistent, and the former only came deep-fried. If deep-fried chicken is your thing, then maybe you'd like this place. But even so: the deep-fried chicken teriyaki I got was full of gristle and tasted terrible. My boyfriend loves meat and tried to finish my dish (I just ate rice)...and even he admitted it was bad.

Small portion for the price. Mediocre food. If you are hungry and want some good food or drinks, go to Taisho, Rai Rai Kan, or any place in east village that opens late. Don't come here or you will be disappointed.

They have really great Japanese fried chicken and fantastic beer and sake prices! Sometimes the TVs can be a bit overwhelming and it's hit or miss with who else is eating here. The most fun I've had was when it was a sleepy rainy night and we were the only ones there. They played great reggae tunes. The staff is super sweet as well.
The nicest delivery man I have ever met, and the food is amazing as well. I cannot be more impressed!
No comment
No comment

Everyone says to get it, so honestly just follow the crowd. The chicken nanban is so tender and juicy. It strips away easily. The tartar sauce gives it a really great flavor, and it comes with salad, rice, and soup. The portions are generous so I'm always busting by the seams when I'm done eating, or I'll have a few pieces to take home as leftovers. Also, the service is good, and the waiters are friendly, smiley, and attentive. I've also gotten the katsu don before and it's also very tasty.
No comment

Yummm!  I had the japanese-style barbecued steak (don't remember the name) at the recommendation of the staff, and it was delish.  Will definitely be coming back for more. The place is also meticulously clean.  Good job.

Based purely on the delivery experience, the menu is pretty limited, but everything we ordered was good.  We ordered the katsu don, chicken nanban, and the kurobua tonkatsu.  All were good and roughly 12-14 dollar each.  All I would recommend to anyone.  They also offer sushi rolls.  But I would stay with the savory entrees.  Delivery was quick, food wasnt cold, everything turned out well.  Will definitely be on the list to try again.

Best chicken karaage ever. Juicy, flavorful, and tender. The rice is good too. I've never been to the place but I order the garlic chicken, teriyaki chicken, and chicken karaage pretty much every week. The delivery guy is really nice and polite. They are sometimes late but then they compensate by giving free drinks.

So I spoke to one of the workers there and they told me that they are waiting for their liquor license before they open for lunch... not sure what they two have to do with each other, but the food is still great.

We came here before a show. The theater was just 2 blocks away and we had about 50 mins, so we thought why not! The food was great with reasonable price. But it took too long for them to prepare. We ended up 15 mins late for the performance, and couldn't finish our meal. People said it wasn't usually like that, but if I am in a hurry and in the neighborhood again, I probably won't walk in there. Otherwise, they are pretty decent

Ichibantei is my favorite place to eat whenever I am in the city. The place has a unique atmosphere that really enhances your dining experience. The staff are very attentive and friendly. The food is amazing. The Kaarage chicken is to die for as is the Garlic chicken. Portion sizes are perfect. Most entrees come with a side of rice, miso soup, and a salad but they don't skimp on the main dish. You get a healthy serving of meat that makes the meal feel like a great value. I don't know of many places in the city where you can get a great meal for two for under $40. You can't go wrong with Ichibantei!
No comment
The only Japanese restaurant I know of in NYC, that serve real Chicken Nanban ($10 and comes with rice & shredded cabbage).  The staff is very friendly and even hooked me up with a free Taiyaki!!
No comment

This place has great food at good prices. For $8-12 you can walk out  full and the food is extremely interesting. The nanban and black pork are great and I can't way to try mire. The cute japanese girl who usually works at the counter is very nice and always willing to suggest her favorites. You gotta try this place they really deserve your business.
Food is amazing and delivery guy is super nice. Order fast though cuz it can take a while to arrive.
Nice frosted mug of beer, the cold and hot ramen are the best as well as the Karaage chicken and salad!

Rather decent tonkatsu here! Crispylicious and went well with a reasonable serving of rice. The menu isn't the cheapest you can find in the East Village, but still rather comparable for the food. Definitely worth checking out and comparing with the other places around here, although I don't know if I would come here consistently.

Stopped by here pretty soon after it opened and was met by a very welcoming staff. One of the owners and I explained the various dishes to my friends who aren't too familiar with Japanese food. Everything we ordered was delicious and my tonkatsu was the best I have had in a long time. Super nice inside and clean.

Usually pretty busy and this place is quite tiny. The atmosphere makes you feel like you're in an underground japanese bar. Food is flavorful but can be on the greasy/yummy side - especially any pork belly. Amazing food to pair with a frosted cold beer.
Great food, great attitude and definitely delivered within a reasonable amount of time. I ordered the recommended chicken nanban... Bomb!

My girlfriend and I go here at least 2 to 3 times per month. The simple recipe for a great restaurant is good food and friendly staff and Ichibantei has just that. My go-to dishes are the Chicken Nanban and Katsu Don.
No comment
The only place I know of that serves Japanese food with reggae music. It's more like a bar than a restaurant. Cool place to chill with buddies.

This place looks like a cheap chinese takeout from the outside, but don't be fooled - authentic japanese waiting to be served!  Food was quite delicious - well we only got the karaage but they were so nicely fried and juicy!

excellent low key spot. focus here is katsu, fried goods, sake and reggae. yup, the japanese are the biggest reggae heads on this planet outside jamaica. and whoever commented about "japanese soul food" sounding funny.. what's there not to understand? order something here and there's your answer.

No credit card, no alcohol served, no water (isn't there laws against this), ok food, saw many people walk in and walk right back out.  Prices changes depending on what they feel like charging you.  Compare the board vs. the menu.

Tizzzzyizzzzzyiiiiight. Loved it. A true muddafooking gem. Japones soul food with carribean decor and reggae music...am i pulling your chain? nah, mon, i no pull your chain. There's flag on the ceiling that says smthg about japanese soul food. I was delighted by this place well before dipping into the food. That being said, the food is quite satisfying. I had the tonkatsu (fried pork) and a fried chicken appetizer. It was taaasty, as was the sauce. Sizeable mugs of Sapporo for $5, glass for $3 and another, i believe japanese, beer on offer. They also have Japanese wines (say wha??)--red and white--and a good-sized sake list. This is definitely an eatery i wish to introduce many a friend to, but only those friends on the A list. Do yoself a service and get acquainted with the Ichibantei. You've earned it.
No comment

No comment
No comment

Absolutely love going here. The ambiance is so romantic; whether is be on a date or with friends. Service is always catering you and makes sure you're being taken care of. And the FOOD is so tasty and changes often so I like that when I come back every now and then that there's always something new
No comment
No comment

Aurora is super cozy, warm, has dim lights, the perfect romantic setting. I made a reservation with my family and friends, they seated us right away once we had the entire party ready. I ordered the ravioli which is a popular dish there and it was the best ravioli I've had, the cheese, mushroom, and sauce made the dish even better. Our server Juan was so kind, polite, and patient with us. I don't drink alcohol and I asked him if they had mocktails but they didn't and he still suggested a pretty good alternative. I had some of the octopus appetizer as well and I highly recommend it. I'm not a seafood type of girl but it has an amazing taste.

No comment
No comment
No comment

This place is a hidden gem. I loved that they served what I believe to be authentic Italian cuisine. I came with a group of friends. We decided to do family style by ordering different things and trying it out. We ordered the arancini, shishito peppers, calamari, and the kale salad. For dinner, I had the steak (medium) which was delicious. I cleaned my plate! Our waiter was also attentive and suggestive. I love when they know the menu. I can't wait to go back because everything was great.
No comment

We had a lovely dinner here while celebrating a friend's birthday. We had a reservation and it was actually quite busy for a Tuesday evening. The restaurant itself is beautiful, lots of character, intimate atmosphere - the patio in particular is very pretty. We shared some appetizers and each ordered an entree. I love that they constantly change the menu and specials. They do a great job highlighting seasonal produce. We enjoyed all of the food and the cocktails as well. The pasta itself, which is made in-house, was delicious. I would certainly recommend this place!

First time visiting after walking around Williamsburg neighborhood with Jordan (pictured). Off the bat, the service was great. I decided to start the order with dessert and the waitress was excited to help me choose and provided their dessert menu. I ordered a tiramisu ($9) and Meyer Lemon + ricotta cake ($10) because I couldn't decide between both. Safe to say they were DELICIOUS. Jordan ordered Prosciutto di Parma ($21) to share, honestly it was pretty good. Left feeling light and satisfied, will definitely come back.

I visited this restaurant for a birthday celebration, and it was the perfect choice. The food was exceptional, and the staff went above and beyond to make our night special. The drinks were also expertly crafted, and the atmosphere was lively and fun. I would definitely recommend this restaurant for any celebratory occasion.

First time at Aurora. I ordered the spinach omelette which was delicious. Our server Roberta was so sweet, charismatic, and attentive. We sat outside, which was a beautiful green house type of ambiance that I appreciated. It was a little warm (they had the heaters on high), so I recommend layering up. Overall, I thoroughly enjoyed my experience at Aurora.
No comment
The bone marrow appetizer was delish! I loved the combo of mushrooms with greens! The ambiance was inviting yet cozy!! Service was quick!! Absolutely loved the pasta I had!!
No comment

Absolutely everything was super delicious! For apps we had octopus, calamari and the squash (?) salad - so delicious! For dinner we had the steak for two which came with two sides and the smashed potatoes were mega Yumm! Drinks are strong and yummy too. All the staff were very kind- Def will be back!
No comment
No comment

The entrees here are all absolutely delicious! Cannot recommended the pasta enough. Absolutely cleaned my plate. Drinks were fine, but pricey, appetizer was good. I have to say I was very disappointed with the dessert. Interior is very pretty and I cannot wait to see their outside terrace/patio area in the summer. A good spot for a delicious and upscale feeling meal (while not totally breaking the bank).

Super cute with a good, relaxed atmosphere. The service is actually pretty quick once you order things but the staff lets you go at your own pace without rushing you. The food is good, I'd definitely recommend the pastas. I think the lemon ricotta cake could've used a bit more flavor but I was still happy with it. And the drinks are good for the price point.
No comment

i was wildly underwhelmed with this establishment with both the aesthetic and the food. It seems most people come for the outdoor seating which looking great as you walk by but when you actually are seated, it falls short of the charm it seemingly eluded. but the food.. lackluster and bland.

My friend recommended Aurora and I'm glad she did! Very pretty indoor and outdoor spaces. We sat in the outdoor dining structure which was cozy. They have an extensive wine list and I was happy to see they had (very reasonably priced) Soave so we shared a bottle of that. I ordered the squid ink paccheri that came with toasted breadcrumbs, tomatoes, shrimp, and most importantly sea urchin. I could eat this dish over and over again, it was so incredibly good! The seafood in the dish tasted super fresh and the flavors meshed so well together. My friend ordered the ravioli with burata and eggplant which she also enjoyed. Highly recommend!

No comment
No comment

Located in Williamsburg, aurora is a nice Italian restaurant with amble outdoor area and a little indoor area. I sat outdoors on a summer night with a group of friends. We got the Croquettes, Fried Calamari, pork chops and spinach tagliatelle. The pork chops were probably the best thing we had to eat. It was very tender and juicy and well seasoned. The tagliatelle was good but could have been a meatier portion. The appetizers were also really good. Would return for the pork chops for sure!!! Also had the Grand St. drink which was really good. Great for groups. Good outdoor area.
No comment
I came here for dinner for NYE night. Great food. The pasta good and the Bread pudding delicious. Really liked the fried Calamari. Will be back to try their brunch.
I LOVE the Croquettes and the restaurant's patio area is beautiful. The service was great and when trying all the dishes, I see the similarities between here and Evelina.

Father's Day brunch with my family. Beautiful day to sit in their patio. The brunch menu was just what we needed. The service was good if not a bit slow but I chalk that up to a holiday Sunday.
We had the greatest dinner and Levi was an exceptional server!    We will definitely be back for brunch!   ‍‍

column3: East Side of Stamford, Stamford, CT
column6: Go to aurora and ask for Levi! He's the best. The cacio Pepe is amazing. We'll be back for brunch
No comment

Aurora is one of the best restaurants in Williamsburg! This was my third time dining there and they have consistently shown their great quality of service and food. We had a reservation and were seated right away in their beautiful outdoor garden area. Our drinks came out quickly and were good portions. We ordered the croquettes with risotto and grilled artichokes to start which were delicious. Our favorite dish, the tonnarelli cacio e Pepe was amazing! We also ordered the ravioli with spinach, ricotta, and mushrooms which was great as well. One of our friends who is originally from Italy was blown away with the food. For that reason alone, it is clear the Italian food here is authentic and a must try restaurant!
Not only amazing food and drinks but the atmosphere and vibes are unmatched! Perfect for a date night or special occasion!
No comment

5+ stars... Our server Juan José was nothing less than amazing and his attention to detail in accommodating our group for Jane's graduation made all the difference. The food is beyond delicious - literally everything was so good - with great great staff and service, and the out of this world food we will definitely be back. Aurora is a MUST try!!

This place is jam packed on a weekend so make reservations if you're planning to dine here. I came for lunch and had a wonderful meal. The food is fresh, tasty, plated beautifully and well thought out. The employees were very sweet to our dog as we enjoyed the lovely outdoor seating. My best friend frequents the place and raves about it constantly. I've only been once but the food was delicious.
No comment

Great Italian restaurant with homemade pasta. The menu was very pecorino heavy but staff was super accommodating in replacing it if you don't like sheep cheeses. I had the burrata ravioli which was a really hefty portion! Restaurant is really cute and outdoor area is really nice!

Excellent food, nice ambiance, good service. Try the paccheri with squid ink, tomato sugo, lump blue crab, wild shrimp, chili, and rustic breadcrumb; or the Creekstone Farms NY Strip steak, with crispy potatoes, broccoli rabe, and hazelnut romesco. Accompany them with a glass of Pecorino Terre di Chieti. End your dinner with some Barolo Chinato or Amaro Averna. So why not give it five stars? The food came out suspiciously quickly, almost as if it had been waiting there partially cooked. But perhaps I'm just paranoid.
No comment

Amazing food and the atmosphere is great. The staff was very attentive and the experience was seamless. We ordered calamari and the several pastas and they were all delish, al dente, and seasoned well. Would recommend this restaurant to anyone

I have eaten here on two different occasions with the most recent being 7/17/2022. My girlfriend and I decided to revisit this place after we had come two years ago for my birthday since we didn't get to try the pasta. We sat in their garden area towards the back right of the restaurant. I will say, the pasta did not disappoint. However, the reason for my 1-star review was the rats that were running around behind us. I didn't get through all my pasta when I noticed them and from that moment I couldn't eat anymore. Some other guests there also noticed the rats and one of them even went up to the area where they were to try to get a better look. When I called our waiter over and discreetly mentioned the issue, he nonchalantly told us "Well, this is Brooklyn. There is nothing I can do about it". He then asked if we wanted to move inside instead of apologizing about it first. At that point, we just wanted to get out of there so we requested the check. For them to give us a response like that knowing that is a clear health violation that can get the business shut down is unacceptable. It doesn't matter what borough you are in. A visual sign of rats is a clear indication of what is happening inside the restaurant and if it has a chance to affect my food? No thank you!

No comment

Food is beyond delicious and servers/bussers are nice and attentive -but I've gone there a couple of times with reservations and the weekend host tries to sit you outside as if you're a walk-in. It's rude- ask if the reservation would like to- don't just assume it's ok to bring them to sidewalk seating when they went out of their way to reserve a table.

Amazing spot in Williamsburg. Visiting from out of town and a friend brought me here. We had reservations. We shared (3 of us) the kale salad, calamari and prosciutto with burrata cheese. Then we each ordered a different pasta. The portions were perfect size. We also ordered the Domino cocktail which has watermelon. Great food.

I came here with my friend for dinner as we were in the area and I had heard really good things about it. We were able to snag a table outside (even though it was on the colder side), it was pretty warm in the sidewalk setup. We both ordered the Cacio E Pepe and it was delicious! The service was pretty good, though we did have to wait a while to get our check. The ambiance was really nice and it would be perfect for a date or catching up with a friend. Would definitely come back here again!

Can't recommend it at all. Indoor dining went way over the allowed 50% capacity, not to mention the outdoor space which was super crowded. The tables were ridiculously small and it was impossible to sit there comfortably. The music was super loud, we couldn't keep up a conversation as we couldn't hear each other. Out waiter was absolutely terrible: he spilled my cocktail all over the place, to the floor and onto the table then spilled the fries as well to my husbands lap an on the floor--it hasn't even crossed his mind to replace the fries with a new one given that the 1/3 of it ended on the floor. The food is mediocre, the burger patty was chewy. The cocktail was awful: it should've been a mix of different drinks (hence the name and according to what was on the menu) but I only could taste the very strong, cheap booze. A waste of money, not a pleasant memory whatsoever.
No comment

This place was top notch from start to finish! Exceptional food, atmosphere and service. We split the croquettes that were filled with risotto, mozzarella, tomato and basil. This was probably are least favorite thing that we ordered but still good. My sister had the risotto with aged ricotta, mushrooms, spring garlic and stracciatella. This dish was so creamy, rich and extraordinarily delicious. It was like a warm hug in your belly. I had the ravioli with cherry tomatoes, eggplant confit, basil and aged ricotta. The sauce was fairly light but very flavorful and also very tasty. We did things a little backwards but had another appetizer for our dessert. The sourdough, whipped ricotta, roasted mushrooms, lemon curd and oregano hit the spot and finished it off. Our waiter was attentive and friendly and the atmosphere was warm and inviting. We sat in the terrace which was pretty. I highly recommend this restaurant....definitely worth it!

Aurora is a nice little new school Italian restaurant. It restored my faith in Italian food after the horrible debacle at Il Cortile in Little Italy. Let me tell you, nothing compares to fresh pasta, fresh bread, & great cocktails. My only complaint is service: Our waitress took our order and left the job site. If it were not for the bussers, we would've been completely forgotten.

Nice place with a cute atmosphere. Staff is great and let's you relax without pressure to finish fast which is nice. Food was well cooked and had a ton of flavor and the pasta was portioned perfectly. They have a big wine selection and the waiter was knowledgeable and able to help pick up the perfect match. Lots of daily specials that are to die for! Good place for a special occasion dinner or just a classy night! Pretty much all of the dishes can be made gluten free and they also offer gluten free pasta, staff is knowledgeable about cross contamination and it's safe for celiac people.

I'll give this Evelina (right) a 5 stars. You almost can't notice the second drink due to the pure radiance of the Eve. Although the rosemary was in my nosemary when sipping, it was worth it. Will return.
No comment

Their patio and indoor area is very pretty but unfortunately most of the times they won't accommodate walk-ins except for their sidewalk tables, and usually with a long waiting time. I've tried to come 3 times and only have been able to eat here once. We tried the ink calamari croquettes they were crispy outside and creamy inside. The kale salad was also good as a side dish. The grilled octopus has a good flavor but texture is hard and dry, the portion is a tentacle (regular portion of most restaurants) but cut in HALF. they only serve one half...so no, I wouldn't recommend ordering that. Order a drink instead they are good.
No comment

The staff are so nice, I can't remember the name of the dish I had but it savory with a little kick of sour very flavorful! And I pair this dish up with white wine suggested by staff so amazing! If you liked Italian cuisine I think you'd better try this! Amazing deco and very good service mind!

I forgot to book a table at Lilia, so I booked Aurora instead. I'm not sorry that I did. Aurora is a tiny restaurant on Grand Street that serves amazing food. There is a lot of outdoor seating, so don't hesitate to book. The menu is very small, but very well executed. Our Octopus was fabulous, as was our Tuna Tartare. We ordered Striped Bass as our Main course and it was fabulous. I'm cancelling our reservations at Roberta's tomorrow and coming back.

Stunning brunch setting on their beautiful patio. Super rustic decor made even more beautiful with Ivy covered walls. The service is impeccable and the food absolutely delicious! My family thoroughly enjoyed decadent plates like Eggs Benedict, Carbonara, and Brioche French Toast. I absolutely devoured the Cacio e Pepe made with Gluten Free pasta. All this and drinks to top it all off!

Tiny spot with exceptional pasta. Arancini were perfect. Had the strangozzi with porcini and sausage and tasted the pappardelle Bolognese. Oooofa tastes like Italia on vacation! Homemade pasta and super fresh, delicate and delicious ingredients create an exceptional and relaxed dining experience. Service is on point. Aurora is a must try!
The food here is simply wonderful.  Ingredient driven. Well done.  Nice setting.  I highly recommend

Great food and environment. Price is a bit high but similar to other restaurants in the area.

Super cute and warmly decorated place. Appetizers were ok - not great. Creative pasta dishes - menu appeared a bit slim but ultimately enough choices for all of us. The pasta dishes were great. Service was good.
This is a great spot. The atmosphere is great. The outdoor seating is always a plus during summer days. This is place is have a nice dinner, even brunch. Food is good and Wine always recommend.
Food was so good!!! Atmosphere was amazing, service was excellent! (Thanks Elliot!) I definitely recommend this place and it was also recommended to me by friends who live in the area! Love

Amazing Italian food and amazing hospitality. The staff here are incredible, the food does not disappoint. Highly recommend the octopus appetizer and the prosciutto and burrata are to die for. They also have this special focaccia with fresh herbs I believe was rosemary baked into it that is so good. Got the pappardelle and squid ink pasta. Both fantastic. All of the deserts were incredible, the pistachio ice cream was out of this world. Cocktails and wine selection was also amazing. The entire staff were friendly, service was super quick, staff wore masks all around excellent experience. Evr is incredibly kind and gives excellent recommendations.

I've had this place bookmarked for so long. Finally got to come with family and I have to say... overrated! Nothing special and overpriced. The ambiance and decor was super cute. But that's about it. I really wanted to like it. Just bland.

Great ambiance! The pistachio dessert was great and the pastas are fresh and delicious. Great place for a wonderful dinner!

Aurora is a neighborhood staple! Always and forever will be ordering the rice balls and black squid pasta with lump crab. Then do yourself a favor and try a special bc I've had plenty and they're always delicious! Staff is familiar and nice for the most part, although not incredibly accommodating (one time didn't seat my party during a snow storm b/c it was 15 min before their opening time). Other than that really nice place to enjoy an authentic meal.

Foods were ok, very noisy and crowded. I reserve them on open table but they checked me as no show so now my open table account is deactivate ugh.  Tried to call them multiple times but directed to reservation. Nothing special about the food just ok.

Stopped by for Saturday brunch and was able to be seated outside immediately without a reservation. Tons of outdoor seating, including a beautiful patio! Highly recommend the crab & avocado eggs benedict; it seems pricey ($20) but it's LOADED with lump crab and is definitely worth it. The toasted filone with ricotta and mushrooms ($16) was also delicious, but the crab eggs benny was still the star. The drinks were a little weak for the price ($12 mimosa and $14 cocktail), but tasty.

I've ordered from Aurora multiple times, & the food has always been amazing. However, I ordered the branzino on Monday night, & woke up with a bout of food poisoning at 2 am. To be clear, I have no food allergies, nor did the branzino seem off in any kind of way. I suspect whomever seasoned the branzino didn't wash their hands properly before handling it. It sucks, b/c it was honestly delicious, but I can't trust a restaurant that doesn't adhere to strict cleanliness guidelines.

Everything we got here was delicious. Good outdoor environment and great vibes all around. Got the rice balls, chicken sandwich, and meat tomato pasta dish - all delicious. One of the best dining experiences I've had in a while (:

Had a great dinner at Aurora. I had one of the pasta dishes, tuna tartare and chocolate cake for dessert. The service was great and very friendly. The ambiance was also great. Would definitely recommend for a nice dinner if you're in the area!

Cute restaurant perfect for date night or brunch! So in order to access their outdoor dining area, the restaurant has you check in with the hostess inside and then they bring you outside. The restaurant should just have the hostess outside. Extremely convoluted system. We started off with the octopus which I didn't love. My fiancé loved it. They left this chewy skin like part on it. I had the peach summer salad which was really good minus the mint & my fiancé had the burger with  fries!! The fries are the reason to go plus the cute outdoor dining. The staff is super nice and they have the mobile hand held devices for you to pay so it's easy. Def must check out.

Amazing eggs benedict! The service is great. The outdoor seating in the back is so cute!

Wonderful place. Lamb Lollipops were amazing. Staff is great and friendly. The chocolate martini is strong.

The cocktails were delicious and we ordered the French toast and eggs Benedict. Both were phenomenal, the French toast bread was Devine and sooooo fluffy and the berries were so fresh!! Def want to come back and try their dinner menu and would come back for brunch!!

I enjoyed eating at Aurora. I had the Croquettes, squid ink risotto, lemon, fior di latte mozzarella and  I was pleasantly surprised. It was a delicious appetizer that was filling and the outdoor ambiance was nice as well. The food had fresh ingredients imported from Italy! My friend had the octopus from the brunch menu and enjoyed her meal as well.

Sat in the garden on a weeknight with a group of five and had a great dinner. Standout dishes were the delicate squash, ravioli and Tonnarelli Cacio & pepe. Also enjoyed the burrata and prosciutto, Montauk diver scallops, roasted sunchokes and mushrooms. Only thing I didn't love was the broccoli rabe (it's not my favorite anyway). Overall a great spot!

So good! Everything I have had here has been amazing. Patio is super cute. My daughter declared the burger the best she's ever had, and that's a high honor haha!

So we did not have a reservation but fortunately we were still able to get a table. My first impression of the place is that they have beautiful greenery but once I interacted with the host he was very snippy and I guess he had his friends at a table because I saw him go over there to sneak a sip to drink a few times. Anyway we were seated on the side walk which was still fine but it took the waitress awhile just to bring water to us and also to even bring the mixed drinks we ordered over. The drinks we had were nothing to rave about. We ordered the croquettes to start and they were delicious but the fried calamari we ordered was dry and oily. For dinner I ordered the ravioli and it was actually pretty decent, we also got skirt steak and it was good but the quantity of the dish was lacking. There was a few slices of steak on a plate but not much to eat. Overall I'm giving this place a 2 star because the hospitality was lacking, waitress was lacking, and food was just ok. At this price point the standards should be higher. A little disappointed but maybe next time my experience will be better.

Came here for brunch with some friends. Very few choices, not many things on their menu. I really liked the ambience, the garden, but I didn't like our waitress. She didn't have any patience and didn't know much about the menu. Also a bit too pricy.
The croquette was amazing and the scallops were on point. Made for an epic Valentine's Day with my special girl!
